classes.documentation: SUB.ASSET.TYPE As the title suggests this file contains a further definition of an asset. For reporting purposes and information retrieval at account officer level. Once a security is opened at security master level and given an asset number the user can further define that position by utilising this file. A suggested example would be where for reporting purposes both within the Bank and as regards the client an Equity would be given an asset type"1". But within the Securities Module there are many different types of security. To which end the Sub Asset type is used to define these various holdings. Partly paid shares,fully paid shares and new nil paid shares are just 3 examples of sub asset types within the asset type Equities.
classes.name: SUB_ASSET_TYPE

properties.documentation: Unique reference which identifies the SUB ASSET TYPE. Validation Rules 1-5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: CUST_STAT_GRP_CODE

properties.documentation: Specifies the Asset.Type that this SUB ASSET TYPE is a sub-classification of. Validation Rules 1 to 3 numeric character Asset.Type code. (Mandatory input.) Must exist as a valid ASSET TYPE.
properties.name: ASSET_TYPE_CODE

properties.documentation: Indicates whether or not the SUB.ASSET.TYPE is a Kassenobligationen. If a new security masterfile record is being set-up and the specified SUB.ASSET.TYPE contains "YES" in this field, then the user is able to leave the MATURITY.DATE blank. Usage of this facility will necessitate your being forced to enter any Kassenobligationen trade maturity date directly onto the SEC.TRADE or other T24 security transaction. Validation Rules Only input of 'KASBON', 'YES' or 'NO' allowed. Optional Input. Default is NULL (meaning NO) (Optional Input)
properties.name: KASSENOBLIGATIONEN

properties.documentation: Specifies the percentage of the asset/liability as defined by the SUB.ASSET.TYPE to be used in portfolio valuations. This is the second level of checking when Securities programs value other (non securities) assets. If a value is not found on the ASSET.BY.CATEG file then this percentage rate is applied to the value of the sub-asset involved. Depending upon whether a valuation should include/exclude liabilities, either this field or LOSS.MARGIN.RATE will be used to calculate the margin value. The method of calculation is defined in the field MARGIN.VALUE in SC.PARAMETER If no value is found on either file then a margin rate of 0% is assumed. Validation Rules 1-5 characters Standard Rate format. Optional Input. If entered, must identify a record on the MARGIN.CONTROL file.
properties.name: SEC_MARGIN_RATE

properties.documentation: Reserved for future use.
properties.name: VAR_INTEREST_BONDS

properties.documentation: Price tolerance corresponding to sub asset type. Used as a check to ensure that the difference between the current mid price and that received from the overnight price feed, is within the specified tolerance. If not, reported in the exception report.
properties.name: PRICE_TOLERANCE

properties.documentation: Field to indicate whether or not this SUB.ASSET.TYPE refers to capitalisation bonds. Currently this field is only used by the Bon De Caisse regional development. Validation Rules Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' allowed. Must be 'NO' or left blank except when the KASSENOBLIGATIONEN field is set to 'KASBON' when this can be 'YES', 'NO' of left blank.
properties.name: CAPITAL_BOND

properties.documentation: Specifies the percentage of the asset/liability as defined by the SUB.ASSET.TYPE to be used in portfolio valuations. This is the second level of checking when Securities programs value other (non securities) assets. If a value is not found on the ASSET.BY.CATEG file then this percentage rate is applied to the value of the sub-asset involved. Depending upon whether a valuation should include/exclude liabilities, either this field or MARGIN.RATE will be used to calculate the margin value. The method of calculation is defined in the field MARGIN.VALUE in SC.PARAMETER If no value is found on either file then a margin rate of 0% is assumed. Validation Rules 1-5 characters Standard Rate format. Optional Input. If entered, must identify a record on the MARGIN.CONTROL file.
properties.name: LOSS_MARGIN_RATE

properties.documentation: This field signifies the percentage of the CGT Base amount that will be included in the tax calculation. Validation Rules Optional Input Must be a percentage
properties.name: CGT_BASE_PERC

properties.documentation: This field will select what gets defaulted into a SECURITY.MASTER record in the GRP1.GRP2.METHOD field. Validation Rules LIFO, FIFO or SUMLIFO Optional Input
properties.name: GRP1_GRP2_METHOD

properties.documentation: Supports EU Saving directives. Validation Rules LIFO, FIFO or AVERAGE
properties.name: TAX_BASIS

properties.documentation: Defines the rounding parameters for subscription, redemption and NAV Validation Rules Must be a valid MF.ROUNDING.PARAM record id.
properties.name: MF_ROUNDING_PARAM

properties.documentation: Defines the minimum initial subscription if any in terms of amount. Validation Rules Optional Input.Standard T24 Amount format
properties.name: MIN_INIT_SUBS

properties.documentation: Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met. If MIN.INIT.SUBS is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met. Validation Rules Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'. Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.INIT.SUBS is specified.
properties.name: MIN_INIT_ACTION

properties.documentation: Defines the minimum amount of subscription if customer already has a holding in the fund. Validation Rules Optional Input.Standard T24 Amount format
properties.name: MIN_ENSUING_SUBS

properties.documentation: Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met. If MIN.ENSUING.SUBS is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met. Validation Rules Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'. Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.ENSUING.SUBS is specified.
properties.name: MIN_ENS_ACTION

properties.documentation: The minimum units that needs to be held at any point of time. While redeeming, the system would check the units being redeemed against the current holding to see whether the condition is met. Validation Rules Optional Input. Standard T24 nominal / amount ( NOMAMT ) format.
properties.name: MINIMUM_HOLDING

properties.documentation: Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met. If MINIMUM.HOLDING is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met. Validation Rules Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'. Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MINIMUM.HOLDING is specified.
properties.name: MIN_HLDG_ACTION

properties.documentation: The minimum holding period in days, months or years. At the time of redemption, the system would check whether the units being redeemed have been held for the period specified in this field. The system would check against the holdings being allocated towards the redemption Validation Rules Optional Input.Could be nD, nW, nM or nY where n is the number of calender days, Working days, Months or Years
properties.name: MIN_HLDG_PERIOD

properties.documentation: Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met. If MIN.HLDG.PERIOD is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met. Validation Rules Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'. Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.HLDG.PERIOD is specified.
properties.name: MIN_PERIOD_ACTION

properties.documentation: The minimum amount or number of units that could be redeemed at any point of time. If the holdings are less than the minimum specified here, the transaction would be allowed without any checks Validation Rules Optional Input. Standard T24 nominal / amount ( NOMAMT ) format.
properties.name: MIN_REDEMPTION

properties.documentation: Defines whether the Minimum redemption specified is in terms of value or units. If VALUE is defined here and the redemption is in terms of units, the system would convert the units into value terms at order / trade stage based on prevailing NAV and raise override/error as the case may be and vice versa. Validation Rules Optional Input. Allowed values are 'UNITS' or 'VALUE'
properties.name: MIN_REDEM_UNIT_VAL

properties.documentation: Defines whether error or override needs to be raised when minimum condition as above is not met. If MIN.REDEMPTION is specified and this field is left blank,the system would raise override when the condition is not met. Validation Rules Optional Input. Allowed values are 'ERROR' or 'OVERRIDE'. Would be defauled to 'OVERRIDE' when left blank and MIN.REDEMPTION is specified.
properties.name: MIN_REDEM_ACTION

properties.documentation: Risk level for suitability checking. Validation Rules Cross-referenced to EB.LOOKUP table.
properties.name: RISK_LEVEL

properties.documentation: Margin rate for calculating top-up margin amountValidation RulesMaximum of 9 numeric characters is allowed
properties.name: TOP_UP_MARGIN

properties.documentation: Margin rate for calculating sell-out margin amountValidation RulesMaximum of 9 numeric characters is allowed
properties.name: SELL_OUT_MARGIN
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.documentation: Describes the SUB ASSET TYPE. This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the SUB ASSET TYPE in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered. Validation Rules 3 to 35 type AA (alphanumeric, first character must be alpha) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: Describes in abbreviated form the Sub.Asset.Type. This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the Sub.Asset.Type in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered. Validation Rules 3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: SHORT_DESCR

properties.documentation: Only required if field 4 set to "Y". Validation Rules Up to 4 characters.
properties.name: YEAR_BREAKS

properties.documentation: The transaction type for which this charge would be applicable. If ALL is specified, this charge would be applicable for all transaction types, if ALL.CREDIT is specified, this would be applicable for all credit (subscription) transactions, if ALL.DEBIT is specified, this would be applicable for all redemptions. By using different transaction types, it is possible to levy different charges for initial subscription, partial redemptions, full redemptions, switches, etc. Validation Rules Allowed values are 'ALL' or 'ALL.CREDIT' or 'ALL.DEBIT' or a valid SC.TRANS.NAME record Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields.
properties.name: TRANS_TYPE

properties.documentation: This is the ID of FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record where fee details are stored. Validation Rules Must be a valid FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields.
properties.name: CHARGE_CODE

properties.documentation: This would specify whether discount, if any, is in terms of percentage or amount Validation Rules Allowed values are 'PERCENTAGE' or 'AMOUNT' Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields.
properties.name: DISC_TYPE

properties.documentation: This is either discount percentage or amount. If DISC.TYPE is blank, then this would be considered in terms of percentage. The discount would be limited to the extent of fees calculated. Validation Rules If DISC.TYPE is percentage, this should be 1- 100 ( %) else any numeric character indicating amount. Standard T4 Amount format. Fields from TRANS.TYPE to DISC.AMT would be associated multi-value fields.
properties.name: DISC_AMT

classes.documentation: STOCK.EXCHANGE The Stock Exchange code is used at various levels throughout the securities module. At a static information level it is used to record the Stock Exchange where a particular security is usually dealt. For example when setting up details of a security like the Swiss Co. Sulzer Gebruder SF100 within the security master file the inputter would specify that the security was normally traded at the Zurich or Geneva Stock Exchange at transaction level the security purchase/sale facility when accessed with the Sulzer security I.D. Number e.g. 678954-000 the transaction would default automatically to the Stock Exchange entered within the security master. The system would then calculate all local and foreign charges applicable to that security according to the details stored within the Stock Exchange commission tables which are linked to each Stock Exchange by a country code. The user however has the facility to override this Stock Exchange depending on where he has dealt.
classes.name: STOCK_EXCHANGE

properties.documentation: Unique Code used to identify each separate Stock Exchange where securities may be traded. Validation Rules1-5 Alpha numeric characters. Mandatory input. Examples: Zurich Stock Exchange would be set up as Zurich. Basle = Basle
properties.name: STOCK_EXCHANGE

properties.documentation: This field will link the Stock Exchange to a country code which then will access the Stock Exchange calculation tables for automatic calculation of commissions and charges applicable. Each Stock Exchange calculation table has a unique code which happens to be the country code (common T24 country code table) Validation Rules2 Alpha character input. Standard country code.Must be a valid Country Code which exists on the Country Code Table.
properties.name: CALC_COUNTRY

properties.documentation: Indicates the number of days forward the value date is it be. Only used if SETT.DAYS.BASIS is BUSINESS or CALENDAR. The number of days entered will be used to calculate the value date (forward) when a security is traded using this Stock Exchange. Validation Rules1-3 Numeric characters. Input mandatory if SETT.DAYS.BASIS is BUSINESS Input not allowed if SETT.DAYS.BASIS if FIXED. Otherwise input is optional.
properties.name: SETTLEMENT_DAYS

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the value date is to be calculated on a business or calendar day basis. The basis entered in this field will be used to determine how the value date will be calculated given the trade date and the settlement days for this stock exchange. Example The holiday table being set up with Saturdays and Sundays as the weekend days. Trade date of Thursday 4th March and settlement days of 2. If the basis is BUSINESS then the value date will be Monday 8th. If the basis is CALENDAR then the value date will be Saturday 6th. If the basis is FIXED, then the value date will be cal culated on the basis of calendar defined for that particular Stock Exchange & Year in STK.EXCH.CALENDAR (where a Settlement Day is defined for a period) Validation RulesValues allowed are BUSINESS OR CALENDAR OR FIXED. (Mandatory Input)
properties.name: SETT_DAYS_BASIS

properties.documentation: Specifices the country of domicile of the Stock Exchange. Each Stock Exchange calculation table has a unique code which happens to be the country code (common T24 country code table) Validation Rules2 Alpha character input. Standard country code. (Optional Input)Must be a valid Country Code which exists on the Country Code Table.
properties.name: DOMICILE

properties.documentation: The swift market identifier code is defined in this fieldValidation Rules 4 Alphabetical characters
properties.name: MKT_IDN_CODE
en

properties.documentation: Full Description of the Stock Exchange as uniquely identified in Field 'O' This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the Stock Exchange in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered. Validation Rules3-35 Alpha numeric characters free format (Mandatory Input) (Multi language field.)
properties.name: DESCRIPTION

properties.documentation: Short version of Stock Exchange description as uniquely identified in Field 'O' This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the Description of the Stock Exchange in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description is to be entered. Validation Rules1-15 Alpha numeric characters, free format. (Mandatory Input) (Multi Language field.)
properties.name: SHORT_DESCR

properties.documentation: This field and the fields BR.BOND.CNTY to CU.BOND.COMM associated with it allows the used to define any stock exchange levies that will be charged by this Stock Exchange, EBV fees, PTM levy etc. They will be used to update the CU.EBV.FEES or BR.EBV.FEES fields on a SEC.TRADE that uses this Stock Exchange. This set of fields will be used to define the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE records to be used for these fees for bonds. The fields SHARE.LEVY.DATE to CU.SHR.COMM do the equivalent for shares. A bond is defined in T24 as a Security Master record where the BOND.OR.SHARE flag is set to 'B'. This set of flags works as follows; The system will check whether we are dealing with a bond or a share to work out which set of fields to use. It will then take the trade date and compare it against the set of dates in this field until it finds the one that is less than the trade date. It will then decide if we are calculating a customer levy (CU.EBV.FEES) or a broker levy (BR.EBV.FEES). If it is a broker levy it will use BR.BOND.CNTY and BR.BOND.COMM if it is a customer CU.BOND.CNTY and CU.BOND.COMM. It will then take the security domicile of the bond and look for this country in the BR.BOND.CNTY (or CU.BOND.CNTY) field. If it locates it, it will take the associated FT.COMMISSION.TYPE ID from the BR.BOND.COMM (or CU.BOND.COMM) field and use it to calculate the levy. If it does not find the country code then it will look for 'ALL' in the BR.BOND.CNTY(or CU.BOND.CNTY) field and if it is there use the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record associated with it. Validation RulesOptional Input.Any input must be of a standard T24 date format.
properties.name: BOND_LEVY_DATE

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.BOND.CNTY TO CU.BOND.COMM. Will contain a valid Country code or 'ALL'. Will be used by SEC.TRADE to calculate the BR.EBV.FEES for a bond trade done across this stock exchange. Will be used by the system to test against the security domicile to work out which FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record to use. Validation RulesOptional Input.Input must be 'ALL' or exist on the COUNTRY file.
properties.name: BR_BOND_CNTY

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.BOND.CNTY TO CU.BOND.COMM. Will contain the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE ID that defines that levy charged for a broker dealing in bonds at this Stock Exchange. Will be used to calculate the BR.EBV.FEES on any SEC.TRADE done for a bond on this Stock Exchange. Validation RulesOptional Input.Must exist on the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE file.
properties.name: BR_BOND_COMM

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.BOND.CNTY TO CU.BOND.COMM. Will contain a valid Country code or 'ALL'. Will be used by SEC.TRADE to calculate the CU.EBV.FEES for a bond trade done across this stock exchange. Will be used by the system to test against the security domicile to work out which FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record to use. Validation RulesOptional Input.Input must be 'ALL' or exist on the COUNTRY file.
properties.name: CU_BOND_CNTY

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.BOND.CNTY TO CU.BOND.COMM. Will contain the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE ID that defines that levy charged for a customer dealing in bonds at this Stock Exchange. Will be used to calculate the CU.EBV.FEES on any SEC.TRADE done for a bond on this Stock Exchange. Validation RulesOptional Input.Must exist on the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE file.
properties.name: CU_BOND_COMM

properties.documentation: This field and the fields BR.SHR.CNTY to CU.SHR.COMM associated with it allows the used to define any stock exchange levies that will be charged by this Stock Exchange, EBV fees, PTM levy etc. They will be used to update the CU.EBV.FEES or BR.EBV.FEES fields on a SEC.TRADE that uses this STOCK.EXCHANGE. This set of fields will be used to define the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE records to be used for these fees for shares. The fields BOND.LEVY.DATE to CU.BOND.COMM do the equivalent for bonds. A share is defined in T24 as a Security Master record where the BOND.OR.SHARE flag is set to 'S'. This set of flags works as follows; The system will check whether we are dealing with a bond or a share to work out which set of fields to use. It will then take the trade date and compare it against the set of dates in this field until it finds the one that is less than the trade date. It will then decide if we are calculating a customer levy (CU.EBV.FEES) or a broker levy (BR.EBV.FEES). If it is a broker levy it will use BR.SHR.CNTY and BR.SHR.COMM if it is a customer CU.SHR.CNTY and CU.SHR.COMM. It will then take the security domicile of the share and look for this country in the BR.SHR.CNTY (or CU.SHR.CNTY) field. If it locates it, it will take the associated FT.COMMISSION.TYPE ID from the BR.SHR.COMM (or CU.SHR.COMM) field and use it to calculate the levy. If it does not find the country code then it will look for 'ALL' in the BR.SHR.CNTY(or CU.SHR.CNTY) field and if it is there use the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record associated with it. Validation RulesOptional Input.Any input must be of a standard T24 date format.
properties.name: SHARE_LEVY_DATE

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.SHR.CNTY TO CU.SHR.COMM. Will contain a valid Country code or 'ALL'. Will be used by SEC.TRADE to calculate the BR.EBV.FEES for a share trade done across this stock exchange. Will be used by the system to test against the security domicile to work out which FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record to use. Validation RulesOptional Input.Input must be 'ALL' or exist on the COUNTRY file.
properties.name: BR_SHR_CNTY

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.SHR.CNTY TO CU.SHR.COMM. Will contain the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE ID that defines that levy charged for a broker dealing in shares at this Stock Exchange. Will be used to calculate the BR.EBV.FEES on any SEC.TRADE done for a share on this Stock Exchange. Validation RulesOptional Input.Must exist on the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE file.
properties.name: BR_SHR_COMM

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.SHR.CNTY TO CU.SHR.COMM. Will contain a valid Country code or 'ALL'. Will be used by SEC.TRADE to calculate the CU.EBV.FEES for a share trade done across this stock exchange. Will be used by the system to test against the security domicile to work out which FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record to use. Validation RulesOptional Input.Input must be 'ALL' or exist on the COUNTRY file.
properties.name: CU_SHR_CNTY

properties.documentation: Sub valued field associated fields BR.SHR.CNTY TO CU.SHR.COMM. Will contain the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE ID that defines that levy charged for a customer dealing in shares at this Stock Exchange. Will be used to calculate the CU.EBV.FEES on any SEC.TRADE done for a share on this Stock Exchange. Validation RulesOptional Input.Must exist on the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE file.
properties.name: CU_SHR_COMM

This code is validated in Stock Exchange file. (2) - Year - Calendar year. Year should be in the range of 1950 - 2049. Validation Rules7 Character alphanumeric. (Mandatory input)

If an existing calendar is being modified, a check is made to make sure that FROM.DATE is not greater than TO.DATE Validation Rules11 character in Date format.Mandatory input.

properties.documentation: Settlement Date for the period defined. SETTLEMENT.DATE should be greater than or equal to TO.DATE. Also this date should be a working day for the Stock Exchange. If not, next working day is displayed for information. Validation Rules11 characters in Date format.Mandatory input.

classes.documentation: This table contains all the Local Stock Exchange Commissions and Fees as payable on the GERMAN stock exchange. It contains standard default Category and Transaction codes for all P & L related entries as well as the various bands at which different percentages are to be applied and the asset type to which those rates refer. Additionally, it allows the user to store whenever possible the minimum charges payable within that specified stock exchange. It must be pointed out that whereas the system is completely flexible regarding the different levels and rates applicable - a change in the fundamental calculation process would inevitably lead to a program change.
classes.name: STK_EXC_DE

properties.documentation: Specifies the country domicile to which the rates and commissions applicable within any particular stock exchange apply. Notes: At stock exchange the user is prompted for a (CALL.COUNTRY) ID at field 3. Whenever a transaction is entered with a given stock exchange the system will read the appropriate stock exchange calculation tables. It is possible to have 2 or more stock exchanges reading the same calculation table e.g. Basle, Geneva and Zurich. Validation Rules2 type SS (Uppercase alpha) country code characters. (Mandatory Input).Must exist on the COUNTRY.CODE table.
properties.name: COUNTRY_CODE

properties.documentation: No input field. Field automatically defaults to currency of the country as specified at ID. Validation Rules3 type CCY (Currency code) characters. (Default value).
properties.name: CURRENCY

properties.documentation: Default category code for all brokerage type entries contained within these tables. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).
properties.name: BR_BROKRGE_CAT

properties.documentation: Credit transaction code for all brokerage P & L type entries which will be created by this application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
properties.name: BR_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Debit transaction code for all brokerage type P & L entries created within this application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory Input).
properties.name: BR_DB_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Contains the default rate applied by the broker on all transactions in bonds traded on the German Stock Exchange. Validation Rules1-14 type AMT (Stand Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).
properties.name: BR_BOND_BRKG_RATE

properties.documentation: Default rate to be applied on all transactions in shares when traded on the German stock exchange. Validation Rules1-14 type AMT (Standard Amount Format) characters plus a decimal point. (Mandatory Input).

classes.documentation: This table is user defined and particular to the Securities' Module only. It allows the user to set up his own codes for each and every transaction within the Securities Module. The ID for each of these transactions is a 1-3 alpha/numeric code which the user sets up when implementing the system initially. Examples of these codes are:-"SPS" for all security Buy/Sell type transactions;" DIV" for all Dividend payments etc. This table is linked to two other tables within the Securities area:- SC.TRANS.NAME and Transaction (Which is a table type file in common with all other T24 Modules. The SC.TRANS.TYPE file takes the transaction name and links it to both a Securities Credit or Debit Indicator and then specifies whether or not that Entry is a financial Credit or Debit (by using a valid transaction code.) The purpose of these tables is to enable the system to identify the type of transaction being entered and how to post entries. An extra feature is that it allows the user to define and manipulate his own transaction codes.
classes.name: SC_TRANS_TYPE

properties.documentation: Unique reference which identifies the SC.TRANS.TYPE. A user defined code for each and every transaction within the Securities Module which are linked to two additional table type files. (i) SC.TRANS.NAME. (ii) Transactions. Together they enable the system to process all sorts of transactions correctly. A Securities Trade for example would contain two SC.TRANS.NAME Codes linked within the SC.TRANS.TYPE file. A purchase for the client would be "SPR" and a Sale by the Broker "SSL". As mentioned these would be linked within the SC.TRANS.TYPE file under an ID of say"SPS" and it is at this stage that the user would specify which of these codes was a securities Credit type transaction and what financial entry was to be entered against that code. Examples: A Securities' Trade would be given an SC.TRANS.TYPE ID of "SPS". Validation Rules1-3 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: TYPE_OF_TRANS

properties.documentation: The user is now specifying which code opened within the SC.TRANS.NAME file is a Security Debit type transaction. Validation Rules3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters. (Mandatory input which must exist as a valid code on the SC.TRANS.NAME file.)
properties.name: SECURITY_DR_CODE

properties.documentation: The user is now specifying which financial credit code opened within the Transaction Table is to be linked to the Security Debit code entered in field 1. Validation Rules1 to 3 numeric character transaction code. (Mandatory input which must exist as a valid code on the Transaction Table.)
properties.name: FIN_CR_TRA_CODE

properties.documentation: The user is now specifying which code opened within the SC.TRANS.NAME file is a Security Credit type transaction. Validation Rules3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters. (Mandatory input which must exist as a valid code on the SC.TRANS.NAME file.)
properties.name: SECURITY_CR_CODE

properties.documentation: The user is now specifying which financial Debit code opened within the Transaction Table is to be linked to the Security Credit code entered in field 3. Validation Rules1 to 3 numeric character transaction code. (Mandatory input which must exist as a valid code on the Transaction Table.)
properties.name: FIN_DR_TRA_CODE
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: This table is user defined and particular to the Securities' Module only. It allows the user to set up his own codes for each and every transaction within the Securities Module. The ID for each of these transactions is a 1-3 alpha/numeric code which the user sets up when implementing the system initially. Examples of these codes are:-"SPR" for all security purchase type transactions;" DIV" for all Dividend payments etc. This table is linked to two other tables within the Securities area:- SC.TRANS.TYPE and Transaction (Which is a table type file in common with all other T24 Modules. The SC.TRANS.TYPE file takes the transaction name and links it to both a Securities Credit or Debit Indicator and then specifies whether or not that Entry is a financial Credit or Debit (by using a valid transaction code.) The purpose of these tables is to enable the system to identify the type of transaction being entered and how to post entries. An extra feature is that it allows the user to define and manipulate his own transaction codes.
classes.name: SC_TRANS_NAME

properties.documentation: Unique reference which identifies the Sc.Trans.Name A user defined code for each and every transaction within the Securities Module which are linked to two additional table type files. (i) SC.TRANS.TYPE. (ii) Transactions. Together they enable the system to process all sorts of transactions correctly. A Securities Credit and a financial Debit as is the case with a purchase of securities could be given the key SPR. Examples: A Securities' Trade contains two transaction names for example. A purchase and Sale of Securities. These could be given transaction codes of "SPR" and "SSL" and because they are linked within the SC.TRANS.TYPE table the System knows which way to post the Securities and Financial entries. Validation Rules1-3 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: TRANS_CODE
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Specifies the SC.TRANS.NAME. This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the SC.TRANS.NAME in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language as defined in the Language table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Short Name is to be entered. Validation Rules3 to 15 type SS (uppercase alpha or numeric, first character must be alpha) characters Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: SHORT_NAME

classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing Spot Purchases and Sales transactions. These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.
classes.name: SC_STD_SEC_TRADE

properties.documentation: Specifies the Company to which the user must be signed on in order to use the application. Validation Rules 9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL where: CC is 2 alpha character Country code GGG is 3 numeric character Company code LLLL is 4 numeric Local code or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters Mandatory Input No Default Value.
properties.name: COMPANY_CODE

properties.documentation: This field dictates to which Category Code amounts entered within a Liquidation Trade for the Brokerage charged by the Broker concerned should be entered This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Must exist as a valid Category code.
properties.name: BR_BROKRGE_CAT

properties.documentation: Each Category Code will have two transaction Codes assigned to it. A Credit and a Debit. This dictates what type of entry is being processed within a Liquidation Trade . The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules 1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input). Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.

properties.documentation: This field determines whether, upon valuation, a negative margin value for an asset is treated as zero value or as the actual margin value. Where this field contains ASSET or null, a margin value of less than 0 will be treated as a zero. If this field contains LIABILITY, the calculated value will be taken as the margin value. Validation Rules Input must be ASSET, LIABILITY or blank

properties.documentation: Defines the CATEGORY Code to which Credit retrocession on SEC.TRADE will be posted. This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 will be allocated a Category code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules 4 or 5 numeric characters. (Mandatory Input) Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999. Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: RETRO_PL_CAT_CR

properties.documentation: Defines the CATEGORY Code to which Debit retrocession on SEC.TRADE will be posted. This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 will be allocated a Category code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules 4 or 5 numeric characters. (Mandatory Input) Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999. Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: RETRO_PL_CAT_DR

properties.documentation: Specifies the variance from the "LAST.PRICE" field of the SECURITY.MASTER that a transaction will tolerate before prompting the user with an override message. If a price is entered that is greater than or less than the "LAST.PRICE" field of the SECURITY.MASTER for that Security, by more than the percentage specified in this field then the user will be prompted with an override message. Validation Rules 1-9 Numeric characters (Optional input)
properties.name: PRICE_TOLRNC_PERC

properties.documentation: Field controlling whether the Securities module updates the CRF or not. If this field is NO then no CRF entries will be produced by the Securities module with accounting entries being generated instead. Validation Rules No change allowed to the field once the record has been authorised. Only input of 'Y' of 'NO' is allowed.
properties.name: CRF_POST

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether or not unrealised profit from Dealer Book portfolios is posted to the loss provision category or not. Validation Rules Only input of 'Y' or 'NO' allowed. Optional Input.
properties.name: POST_UNREAL_PROFIT

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether to calculate Belgium Tax or not. If this field is left blank then the system will treat it as NO. Validation Rules Only input of 'Y' or 'NO' allowed. Optional input.
properties.name: POST_BELGIUM_TAX

properties.documentation: This field is used to control whether unrealised profit and loss generated by Dealer Book portfolios is posted to a user specified CATEGORY or a user specified Suspense Account. If this field is set to 'Y' the unrealised profit and loss generated by a Dealer Book portfolio is posted to the relevent suspense account. The Category of the suspense accounts are specified on the SEC.ACC.MASTER record defining the Dealer Book portfolio. The fields used are; UNREAL.PROFIT.SUSP for unrealised profit. UNREAL.LOSS.PROV for unrealised loss. If this field is NO then the unrealised profit and loss will be posted to the CATEGORY specified in the UNREAL.PL.CAT.PRT or UNREAL.PL.CAT.LOSS fields of the Dealer Book SEC.ACC.MASTER record. Validation Rules Mandatory Field. Only input of 'Y' or 'NO' allowed.
properties.name: SUSPENSE_UNREAL_PR

properties.documentation: Field allowing the bank to control whether or not the application ORDER.BY.CUST will select blocked portfolios. If this field is set to 'NO' or left blank then the ORDER.BY.CUST application will not select blocked portfolios. If this field is set to 'YES' then the ORDER.BY.CUST application will select blocked portfolios with an override being given if a blocked portfolio is selected. The override will be the blocking narrative from the SEC.ACC.MASTER record for the portfolio if one has been set-up. If one has not been set-up then a message saying the portfolio is blocked will be used. Validation Rules Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' allowed. Will default to NO.
properties.name: BLOCKED_ORDER

properties.documentation: Default delivery instruction code used in SEC.TRADE if the trade is Delivery against Payment. Validation Rules Mandatory Input Must exist on the SC.DEL.INSTR file.
properties.name: DAP_CODE

properties.documentation: Default delivery instruction code used in SEC.TRADE if the trade is Free of Payment. Validation Rules Mandatory Input Must exist on the SC.DEL.INSTR file.
properties.name: FRE_CODE

properties.documentation: Field to allow the used specify whether the SEC.TRADE program will use the principal amount or the total of principal and interest amounts to calculate the customer commission. If the commission should be calculated on the Principal amount of the SEC.TRADE application then PRINCIPAL should be entered. If the commission should be calculated on the total of the principal and interest amounts then BOTH should be entered in this field. Validation Rules Optional Input. The only input allowed is PRINCIPAL or BOTH. Will default to BOTH if no input is made.
properties.name: COMM_PRIN_INT

properties.documentation: Flag to indicate whether the user wants the market price held on the SECURITY.MASTER application defaulted into the CUST.PRICE or BR.PRICE fields on the SEC.TRADE application if no input is made by the user. Validation Rules Optional input. Any input must be either Y or NO. Will default to NO.
properties.name: DEF_CUST_PRICE

properties.documentation: Flag to indicate whether 'time of execution' is to be accepted in Securities transactions or not. If this flag is 'Y' then 'time of execution' (TRADE.TIME) will be accepted by the user. Else TRADE.TIME field will be moved with null. An input of 'NONE' will be accepted if no 'time of execution' is available. Validation Rules Allowed values are 'Y'es/'N'o. (Mandatory Input)
properties.name: TRADE_TIME_FLAG

properties.documentation: This is a YES/NO flag designed to allow the user to specify whether they want to consolidate all the foreign exchange positions on a SEC.TRADE and use these figures to enter exchange rates for the customer side of a SEC.TRADE transaction. If this is required the this flag should be set to YES. If the bank has a requirement to enter a rate for each customer into the CU.EX.RATE.REF field then this field should be set to NO. If this field is set to YES the CU.EX.RATE.REF field on the SEC.TRADE application becomes a no-input field and the user has to enter a rate using the CONSOL.RATE field at the end of the transaction. The CONSOL.RATE field is a multi-valued field requiring a rate to be input for each currency that a customer is settling in that is not the Trade Currency of the SEC.TRADE transaction. If this field is set to NO then the CONSOL.RATE is a no-input field and the fields TRADE.CURR to CON.VAL.DATE inclusive on the SEC.TRADE application are not used. In this case the CU.EX.RATE.REF field become mandatory. Validation Rules Only inpuy of YES or NO allowed.
properties.name: CONSOLIDATE_FX

properties.documentation: The Category to which any customer discount amounts from the SEC.TRADE application are posted. On the SEC.TRADE application it is possible to apply discount to the default customer commission amounts charged to a customer portfolio. If a discount to the default commission is applied then the amount of discount will be posted to the CATEGORY input here. Validation Rules Mandatory Input. Must exist on the CATEGORY application. Any input cannot be less than 50000 or greater than 59999.
properties.name: CU_DISC_CAT

properties.documentation: This is the transaction code to be used if a credit entry is posted to the Category defined in the CU.DISC.CAT field. Each Category code will have two transaction codes associated with it, a credit and a debit. Validation Rules Mandatory input. Must exist on the TRANSACTION application. Must be identified as a credit transaction code on the TRANSACTION application, i.e. the DEBIT.CREDIT.IND field on the TRANSACTION record must be CREDIT.
properties.name: CU_DISC_CR_CODE

properties.documentation: This is the transaction code to be used if a debit entry is posted to the Category defined in the CU.DISC.CAT field. Each Category code will have two transaction codes associated with it, a credit and a debit. Validation Rules Mandatory input. Must exist on the TRANSACTION application. Must be identified as a debit transaction code on the TRANSACTION application, i.e. the DEBIT.CREDIT.IND field on the TRANSACTION record must be DEBIT.
properties.name: CU_DISC_DB_CODE

properties.documentation: YES / NO field to allow the bank to decide whether to default the customer security account on the order execution screen. The system will treat the input of nothing as if the order execution screen will not default the customer security account. Validation Rules Only input of YES or NO allowed.
properties.name: ORD_DEF_SEC_ACCT

properties.documentation: YES / NO field that allows the user to specify whether they want the NET.OPEN.ORD.POS field on the SECURITY.POSITION record to be updated by credit orders or not. Setting this field to YES will result in the NET.OPEN.ORD.POS field being updated by credit orders. The NET.OPEN.ORD.POS field is used by T24 to indicate outstanding orders (orders that have not yet been executed) for a security position. Validation Rules Input of YES or NO allowed. If this field is left blank the system treats this as NO.
properties.name: UPD_OUTST_ORD_CRED

properties.documentation: Default category for amounts posted as EBV Fees by SEC.TRADE transactions. The amounts will only be posted to this category if no category is defaulted by the STK.EXC.NN or SC.TAX.PARAMETER applications. Validation Rules Mandatory input. Must exist on the CATEGORY file.
properties.name: EBV_FEES_CAT

properties.documentation: This is the transaction code to be used is a credit entry is posted to the category defined in the EBV.FEES.CAT field. Each Category Code will have two transaction Codes assigned to it. A Credit and a Debit. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules 1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input). Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: EF_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: This is the transaction code to be used is a debit entry is posted to the category defined in the EBV.FEES.CAT field. Each Category Code will have two transaction Codes assigned to it. A Credit and a Debit. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules 1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input). Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: EF_DB_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Default category for amounts posted as Stamp Tax by SEC.TRADE transactions. The amounts will only be posted to this category if no category is defaulted by the STK.EXC.NN or SC.TAX.PARAMETER applications. Validation Rules Mandatory input. Must exist on the CATEGORY file. Input must be numeric and 4 or 5 charaters long.
properties.name: STAMP_TAX_CAT

properties.documentation: This is the transaction code to be used if a credit entry is posted to the category defined in the STAMP.TAX.CAT field. Each Category Code will have two transaction Codes assigned to it. A Credit and a Debit. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules 1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input). Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: STAMP_CR_TRANS_CDE

properties.documentation: This is the transaction code to be used if a debit entry is posted to the category defined in the STAMP.TAX.CAT field. Each Category Code will have two transaction Codes assigned to it. A Credit and a Debit. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules 1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input). Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: STAMP_DB_TRANS_CDE

properties.documentation: This field is used to control the creation of SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS record from authorised SEC.OPEN.ORDER records. If this field is equal to YES the SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS records will only be created once the authorised SEC.OPEN.ORDER record has had its DEAL.STATUS field set to TRANSMITTED. Otherwise the SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS record will be created at authorisation of the SEC.OPEN.ORDER. Validation Rules Only input of YES or NO will be allowed. Input must be YES if GROUP.ORDER field in SC.PARAMETER is set to MANUAL/AUTOMATIC Optional Input.
properties.name: TRANSMIT_ORDER

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether the Text message displayed during prorating nominal in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS should be displayed or not. Validation Rules Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' is allowed. Optional Input.
properties.name: PRORATA_NOM
en
properties.value: Indicates the prorate nominal, if any

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether the Text message displayed during partial execution to put the order to history in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS should be displayed or not. Validation Rules Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' is allowed. Optional Input.
properties.name: CANCEL_REMAIN_ORD

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether Broker Charges and Commission should be Prorated across customer's or not, during execution of the order and Trade creation. Validation Rules Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' is allowed. Optional Field.
properties.name: PRO_BR_CHGS
en
properties.value: Broker charges and commission should be prorated

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether or not Average Price for customer's is to be calculated or not. Validation Rules Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' allowed. Optional Input.
properties.name: CALC_AVG_PRICE

properties.documentation: This field controls the SEC.TRADE creation from SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS. Example: If Trade Creation is 'BY.PORTFOLIO' then SEC.TRADE's will be created for each Portfolio. Validation Rules Valid options are 'BY.CUST', 'BY.DEPO', 'BY.BROKER', 'BY.PORTFOLIO'. Optional Input. 'BY.CUST' and 'BY.PORTFOLIO' are not supported for service-based orders.
properties.name: TRADE_CREATION
en
properties.value: Controls the SEC.TRADE creation from execution

properties.documentation: An "YES" in this field will mean that entries will be raised for P/L for forward valued Trades for Own Book Portfolio. When this field is set as "YES", the fields CNT.REAL.PL.CAT.PR and CNT.REAL.PL.CAT.LO will become mandatory in SEC.ACC.MASTER. Ex: If there is profit of $1000 on a Trade dated T + 3, the P/L entry will be raised only on Date - T + 3 An YES here will mean that On Trade Date An entry will be raised to the Contingent P/L bucket on Trade Date for $ 1000 On the Value Date The entry to the Contingent P/L bucket will be reversed for $ 1,000 and the Profit will be posted to the original bucket. A "NO" or a blank in this field will mean that NO contingent P/L entries will be posted until the Value Date of the Trade. Validation Rules Valid INPUT = YES or NO This field will be allowed INPUT only if the field TRADE.SETTLE.ACCTG is set as 'SETTLEMENT'.
properties.name: POST_CONT_REAL_PL

properties.documentation: An "YES" in this field will mean that entries for Unrealised P/L for Own Book Portfolios will be raised for positions inclusive of Forward Dated Trades. A "NO" or a blank in this field will mean that Unrealised P/L entries will be raised only the Value Dated Positions. This won't include any forward valued Trades. Validation Rules Valid INPUT = YES or NO This field will be allowed INPUT only if the field TRADE.SETTLE.ACCTG is set as 'SETTLEMENT'.
properties.name: POST_TR_DT_UNRL_PL
en
properties.value: Post Trade Date Unrealised Profit Loss

properties.documentation: When a SECURITY.POSITION has some or all of its nominal blocked against trading this field will dictate how the block will be handled. YES - The user will be issued with an Override Message but trading can still continue. NO - The user will be issued with an Error Message and the record will not be committed. Note : If trying to change the setting to "NO" and there are unauthorised transactions in either the SEC.TRADE or SECURITY.TRANSFER applications then an error message will display. To change to a "NO" make sure all records are authorised or deleted first. Validation Rules "YES" or "NO".
properties.name: OVERSELL_BLOCK

properties.documentation: Determines how broker charges will be calculated. Can be BY.TRANCHE (default value if not set) or BY.BROKER. BY.TRANCHE will calculate charges for each execution, BY.BROKER will calculate charges by broker, these charges will then be allocated on a pro-rate basis for each execution.
properties.name: CHARGE_CALC_METHOD
en
properties.value: Determines how broker charges will be calculated

properties.documentation: This field indicates the Category to which the Treasury P/L entries arising from SEC.TRADE transaction need to be posted. Validation Rules Must be a valid CATEGORY code Must be in the range 50000 to 59999 Mandatory input
properties.name: TREASURY_PL_CAT

properties.documentation: This field indicates the transaction Code to be used in the Credit entry raised for Treasury P/L. Validation Rules Must be a valid TRANSACTION code 1 to 3 numeric characters Mandatory field
properties.name: TREASURY_PL_CR_CDE

properties.documentation: This field indicates the transaction Code to be used in the Debit entry raised for Treasury P/L. Validation Rules Must be a valid TRANSACTION code Mandatory field 1 to 3 numeric characters
properties.name: TREASURY_PL_DB_CDE

properties.documentation: Used by the service agent job AM.SC.MOVEMENT when an SC.OBC.CUST.DETAIL record is created. A local routine defined in EB.API with 2 subroutine arguments in this order, Parent ORDER.BY.CUST record, SC.OBC.CUST.DETAIL record. The routine allows the setting of local reference fields only.
properties.name: OBC_SERVICE_API

properties.documentation: Used by the service agent job AM.SC.MOVEMENT when an SC.SOO.CUST.DETAIL record is created. A local routine defined in EB.API with 3 subroutine arguments in this order, Parent ORDER.BY.CUST record, the current SC.OBC.CUST.DETAIL record and SC.SOO.CUST.DETAIL record. The routine allows the setting of local reference fields only.
properties.name: SOO_SERVICE_API

properties.documentation: Used by the service agent job SEC.OPEN.ORDER.SERVICE when an SC.SEC.TRADE.CUST.DETAIL record is created. A local routine defined in EB.API with 3 subroutine arguments in this order, Parent SEC.OPEN.ORDER record, the current SC.SOO.CUST.DETAIL record and SC.SEC.TRADE.CUST.DETAIL record. The routine allows the setting of local reference fields only.
properties.name: ST_SERVICE_API

properties.documentation: The category code used by the system to post the difference between the broker accrued interest amount and the total customer accrued interest amount when processing a SEC.TRADE via service agents. The account will be in local currency for the specified category code.
properties.name: ACCR_INTR_SUSPENSE

properties.documentation: Defines the transaction code to be used when posting a credit to the account category specified in ACCR.INT.SUSPENSE.
properties.name: AI_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Defines the transaction code to be used when posting a debit to the account category specified in ACCR.INT.SUSPENSE.
properties.name: AI_DB_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: The category code used by the system to post the difference between the total broker charge amounts and the total customer broker charge amounts that have been prorated across the customers when processing a SEC.TRADE via service agents. The account will be in local currency for the specified category code.
properties.name: BROK_CHG_SUSPENSE

properties.documentation: Defines the transaction code to be used when posting a credit to the account category specified in BROK.CHG.SUSPENSE.
properties.name: BROK_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Defines the transaction code to be used when posting a debit to the account category specified in BROK.CHG.SUSPENSE.
properties.name: BROK_DB_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: The category code used by the system to post the balancing accounting entry when processing a SEC.TRADE via service agents. The account will be in local currency for the specified category code.
properties.name: ACCT_BAL_SUSPENSE

properties.documentation: Defines the transaction code to be used when posting a credit to the account category specified in ACCT.BAL.SUSPENSE.
properties.name: ACCT_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Defines the transaction code to be used when posting a debit to the account category specified in ACCT.BAL.SUSPENSE.
properties.name: ACCT_DB_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Allowed value is YES. If set, individual transaction level revaluation process will happen and not for consolidated position.
properties.name: TRANSACTION_REVAL

properties.documentation: Specifies the user defined subroutine for modifying the individual transaction level revaluation amount. If TRANSACTION.REVAL is set, then This routine can be defined to change pl amount, PL category, Suspense account category This routine can be specified as Example.routine(REC.ID, UNREAL.PL,PL.CATEG,SUSP.CATEG, RESERVED.3) where REC.ID is STP id and Transaction id separated by '*' UNREAL.PL is system calculated unrealised pl amount PL.CATEG is PL category SUSP.CATEG is suspense account category RESERVED.3 is for future use
properties.name: TR_REVAL_SUBR
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Multi-valued field containing the SUB.ASSET.TYPE IDs of those SUB.ASSET.TYPES that are excluded from the Swiss Stamp Tax Report program SWISS.STAMP.TAX.RPT. Validation Rules Optional Input. Any input must exist on the SUB.ASSET.TYPE application.
properties.name: SPEC_SUB_ASSETS

properties.documentation: Multi valued field containing a list of Securities Transaction codes where no commission is to be charged by the SEC.TRADE application. If a SEC.TRADE application is input with a Security Transaction code from this list then no commission (customer or broker) will be charged. Validation Rules Optional Input. Any input must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME field.
properties.name: NO_COM_TRN_CDS

properties.documentation: Multi valued field associated with OFS.VERSION field. Valid OFS.SOURCE record id is allowed to be input. The OFS.SOURCE will be used with the associated OFS.VERSION record for authorising applications used in grouping of orders. Validation Rules
properties.name: OFS_SOURCE

properties.documentation: Multi valued field associated with OFS.SOURCE field. Valid VERSION record id is allowed to be input. The OFS.VERSION will be used with the associated OFS.SOURCE for authorising applications used in grouping of orders. Duplicate values are not allowed. Validation Rules -
properties.name: OFS_VERSION

classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing POSITION.TRANSFER and SECURITY.TRANSFER transactions. These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type. The user must create one record for each company on the system.
classes.name: SC_STD_POS_TRANSF

properties.documentation: Specifies the COMPANY to which the user must be signed on in order to use the applications. Validation Rules9 Alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters COUNTRY Code GGG is 3 numeric characters COMPANY Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') company mnemonic characters.Must exist as a valid COMPANY code.
properties.name: COMPANY_CODE

properties.documentation: For a POSITION.TRANSFER transaction the system must have a default to a delivery instruction type as contained within the SC.DEL.INSTR table as it is not an input within the transaction itself. As there are no delivery instructions contained within the POSITION.TRANSFER application this field must contain the exact user requirement. Examples: For a normal POSITION.TRANSFER there would be no inherent delivery to be made externally and the delivery instructions would reflect this fact with a no delivery, no payment flag set. Validation Rules1-5 Alphanumeric characters. Standard delivery instruction. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.DEL.INSTR table.
properties.name: DELIVERY_INSTR

properties.documentation: A valid security transaction type which has been set up in the SC.TRANS.NAME and SC.TRANS.TYPE tables for "Credit" transactions. As this is not input at transaction level within the SECURITY.TRANSFER the system must default to this transaction code. Validation Rules1-3 Alphanumeric characters. Standard securities transaction name. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: SEC_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: A valid security transaction type which has been set up in the SC.TRANS.TYPE tables for "Debit" transactions. The System will utilise this default value when a POSITION.TRANSFER is entered. Validation Rules1-3 Alphanumeric characters. Standard securities transaction name. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: SEC_DR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Valid CATEGORY code for use with POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER transactions. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operations. Validation Rules4 or 5 Numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input)Must be in the range 50000 to 59999.Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: CL_CATEGORY_CODE

properties.documentation: Specifies the profit & loss CATEGORY code for all foreign exchange profit & loss calculated within the POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER applications. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operations. Validation Rules4 or 5 Numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input)Must be in the range 50000 to 59999.Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_CAT

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all security "Credit" transactions where foreign exchange profit & loss may occur. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_CR_CD

properties.documentation: The default debit transaction code for all foreign exchange profit & loss related entries within the POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER applications. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_DB_CD

properties.documentation: The default charges on a POSITION.TRANSFER or SECURITY.TRANSFER in local currency. The default charges amount expressed in local currency on input of a SECURITY.TRANSFER or POSITION.TRANSFER. Validation Rules0 - 15 Numeric characters. (Optional Input)
properties.name: DEFAULT_CHARGES

properties.documentation: This field defines the type of delivery advise for deposits (TRANSFERS IN) that will be generated by the ECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field. When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING key 510.SC.0041 (Receipt advise for customer). Validation Rules1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: TTYP_DEPOSIT

properties.documentation: This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (TRANSFERS OUT) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field. When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING key 510.SC.0042 (Internal receipt advise). Validation Rules1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: TTYP_DELIVERY

properties.documentation: This field defines the type of delivery advise for deposits (with confirmation advise) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field. When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field, the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING key 510.SC.0041 (Receipt advise for customer), and if the "DEPOSITORY" field does not equal any of the depositories as entered in the "BANK.DEPO.NO's" in the SC.PARAMETER table the system will generate delivery advises based on DE.MAPPING records 510.SC.0047 (Sending advise to the depository) and 510.SC.0048 (Receipt confirmation to the depository). Validation Rules1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: TTYP_DEPOSIT_CONF

properties.documentation: This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (transfers out with sending advise) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER application based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field. When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING keys 510.SC.0044 (Sending advise to the customer) and 510.SC.0045 (Receipt confirmation to the customer or broker) and, if the broker is not a "BANK.BROKER.NO" as defined on the SC.PARAMETER file a 510.SC.0046 (Delivery confirmation to the customer). Validation Rules1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: TTYP_DLIV_SEND_ADV

properties.documentation: This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (transfers out with collection advise) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field. When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING keys 510.SC.0042 (Receipt advise for sign off at the counter) and 510.SC.0043 (Collection advise for sending to the customer). Validation Rules1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: TTYP_DLIV_COLN_ADV

properties.documentation: This field defines the type of delivery advise for deliveries (to the depository) that will be generated by the SECURITY.TRANSFER applications based on the value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field. When the user enters a value in the "TRANSACTION.TYPE" field of the SECURITY.TRANSFER application that equals the value in this field the system will generate a delivery advise based on the DE.MAPPING keys 510.SC.0043 (Delivery confirmation to the customer) and if the "BROKER.NO" is not a bank broker and defined in the "BANK.BROKER.NO" of the SC.PARAMETER table an advise based on 510.SC.0044 (Delivery advise to the broker). Validation Rules1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME table.
properties.name: TTYP_DLIV_NOTE

properties.documentation: This field defines the percentage of local tax that will be levied on the net value of a SECURITY.TRANSFER. This field is used to calculate the default value of the "LOCAL.TAX" field in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application. If the user does not enter the value in the "LOCAL.TAX" field, then the system will apply this rate to the net value ("GROSS.AMT.SEC.CCY" less "CHARGES") to calculate the local tax owing. Validation Rules0 - 11 Alphanumeric characters (Optional Input)Must be a positive real number greater than zero.
properties.name: LOCAL_TAX_RATE

properties.documentation: Specifies the profit and loss CATEGORY code for the "LOCAL.TAX" amount calculated or entered in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the banks operations. Validation Rules4 or 5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "LOCAL.TAX.RATE" entered else Optional)Must be in the range of 14000 to 14999.Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: LOCAL_TAX_CATEG

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all "Credit" local tax transactions. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600-649 = Securities Validation Rules1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "LOCAL.TAX.RATE" entered else Optional)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: LOCAL_TAX_CR_TR

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all "Debit" local tax transactions. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 - Securities Validation Rules1 - 3 Numeric characters.Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: LOCAL_TAX_DB_TR

properties.documentation: YES/NO flag controlling whether the POSITION.TRANSFER application allows the transfer of short positions. If this field is set to YES then then the transfer of short positions is allowed. If this field is set to NO or left blank then the transfer of short positions will not be allowed. Validation RulesOnly input of YES or No will be allowed.Optional field though if this field is left blank POSITION.TRANSFER will behave as if it were set to NO.
properties.name: SHORT_TRANSFER

properties.documentation: This parameter controls whether POSITION.TRANSFER should allow negative values to be entered in the NO.NOMINAL field or not.This field controls whether negative fund flow should be created or not.Validation Rules Input fieldAccepts a either 'YES', 'NO' or Null Values.
properties.name: CONTRA_REV_TRANS

properties.documentation: Specifies the profit and loss CATEGORY code for the "CU.COMMISSION" amount entered in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the banks operations. Validation Rules 5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.COMMISSION" entered else Optional)Must be in the range of 50000 to 59999Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: CU_COMM_CATEG

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all "Credit" CU.COMMISSION transactions. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.COMMISSION" entered else Optional)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: CU_COMM_CR_TR

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all "debit" CU.COMMISSION transactions.To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.COMMISSION" entered else Optional)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: CU_COMM_DR_TR

properties.documentation: Specifies the internal account CATEGORY code for the "CU.TAX" amount entered in the SECURITY.TRANSFER application. Each business transaction within T24 is allocated a CATEGORY code which enables reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the banks operations. Validation Rules 5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.TAX" entered else Optional)Must be in the range of 10000 to 19999Must be a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: CU_TAX_CATEG

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all "Credit" CU.TAX transactions. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.TAX" entered else Optional)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: CU_TAX_CR_TR

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all "debit" CU.TAX transactions. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code number to the application to which it refers, ranges have been assigned to each application. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input if "CU.TAX" entered else Optional)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: CU_TAX_DR_TR

classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing OPTION.TRADE transactions. These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type. The user must create on record for each company on the system.
classes.name: SC_STD_OPTIONS

properties.documentation: Specifies the COMPANY to which the user must be signed on in order to use the application. Validation Rules9 alphanumerid characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters COUNTRY Code GGG is 3 numeric characters COMPANY Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters.Must exist as a valid COMPANY code.
properties.name: COMPANY_CODE

properties.documentation: Specifies the nominee company in whose name a security is registered. In the eventuality that all OPTION.TRADES within a company are settled into and out of a particular nominee company this field would contain the standard default key for that nominee company. Validation Rules1-5 Alphanumeric input, (type S) standard nominee code. (Optional Input)Must exist on the NOMINEE.CODE table
properties.name: NOMINEE_CODE

properties.documentation: Specifies the type of delivery involved in settling any OPTION.TRADE. Used as the standard delivery instructions for any particular OPTION.TRADE. It may, however, be changed at transaction level. Validation Rules1-5 Alphanumeric characters, (type 'S') standard delivery instruction. (Mandatory Input)Must exist on the SC.DEL.INSTR table.
properties.name: DELIVERY_INSTR

properties.documentation: Specifies the profit & loss category for any potential 'Market' profit or loss with an OPTION.TRADE. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction within T24 will be allocated a CATEGORY code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operations. Note: At the moment the customer price must equal broker price so there is no possible chance of market profit and loss occuring within an OPTION.TRADE. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input)Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: MARKET_PL_CAT

properties.documentation: The default TRANSACTION code for all Credit transactions within OPTION.TRADE where market profit & loss occurs. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code to the application to which it refers ranges have been assigned to each application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. (Mandatory Input)Must exist as a valid TRANSACTION code.
properties.name: MARKET_PL_CR_CODE

properties.documentation: The debit TRANSACTION code for all market profit & loss entries within the OPTION.TRADE. To facilitate the matching of the TRANSACTION code to the application to which it refers ranges have been assigned to each application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. (Mandatory Input)
properties.name: MARKET_PL_DB_CODE

properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing new issue transactions. These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.

properties.documentation: Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application. Validation Rules9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.Must exist as a valid company code.
properties.name: COMPANY_CODE
