classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing bond redemption type transactions. These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.
classes.name: SC_STD_BOND_RED

properties.documentation: Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application. Validation Rules9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
properties.name: COMPANY_CODE

properties.documentation: Used when the automatic bond redemption facility is requested - as it dictates the type of advice run to be processed. In this instance whether it's a pre advice type or not. A pre advice type transaction will remove stock from base security and place it on an identical security no. but with a suffix '-234'. This is the acknowledged early redemption indicator. Note: This type is used for the Automatic Redemption request where the System indicates that the type of Redemption should be a Final type. System cannot possibly identify early or partial draw downs - therefore it can only create a pre advised Final Redemption. Validation Rules1-5 Alpha numeric characters (Type S). Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Redemption Type.
properties.name: PRE_ADVICE_TYPE

properties.documentation: Used when the automatic bond redemption facility is requested. It dictates the type of final advice to be produced; user definition can indicate whether eg. final maturity total or early maturity. Used for SYSTEM created automatic redemption records. Validation Rules1-5 Alpha numeric characters (Type S). Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Redemption Type. For purposed of the AUTOMATIC REDEMPTION facility. The only advice Type possible should be a Final Redemption Type.
properties.name: ADVICE_TYPE
en
properties.value: Denotes the type of the advice

properties.documentation: Where and if a Nominee code formed part of a Redemption Transaction. At transaction level the system would default or assume the Nominee Code ID entered here. As the nominee code is part of the stored security position great care should be used when setting up standard defaults to ensure no problems at Transaction level. Validation Rules1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type S) standard nominee code. Optional input.Must exist as a valid Nominee Code.
properties.name: NOMINEE_CODE

properties.documentation: Defines the standard delivery instructions to be used with a redemption type transaction i.e. delivery of stock out free or against payment. For a redemption the normal type of delivery instruction would be of a type delivery against payment. The delivery instructions impact for example on the SEC. DEL. Control section of portfolio management i.e. is stock to be physically received and/or against a financial consideration. Validation Rules1-5 Alpha numeric characters, (type S). Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Security Delivery Instruction (SC DEL INSTR) code.
properties.name: DELIVERY_INSTR

properties.documentation: Redemptions are by nature security debit type transactions. Here we are setting up a transaction code for that security debit; this code will then be linked within. SC.Trans. type to Form A unique Dr. + and Cr. for all Redemption Type Transactions. Cancellations will automatically assume the CR Type Transaction code. Validation Rules1-3 Alpha numeric characters, (Type S). Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Security Transaction. Name (SC.TRANS.NAME)
properties.name: SEC_DR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: If bonds are to be withdrawn from our safe custody account either via a physical depository (our own Securities Vault) or a Global Depository such as Euroclear in our books the Dr. transaction to the client must have a matching credit to a valid depository Account. For early redemptions where we advise the customer of an impending withdrawal we will likewise effectively do the same for the depository. Validation Rules1-3 Alpha numeric characters (Type S). Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Security Transaction name (SC.TRANS.NAME).
properties.name: DEP_CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Contains the Category Code to which the Foreign Charges for this type of transaction (i.e. Depository Charge) will be posted. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Category Code.
properties.name: CL_FOR_CATEGORY

properties.documentation: Specifies the transaction code to be utilised when passing the Foreign Charge applicable to the client on a redemption transaction. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. Mandatory Input.Must exist as a valid Transaction Change Code.
properties.name: CL_FOR_CR_CODE

properties.documentation: As with Field 8 Customer (Client) foreign charge code and where all credits must have a mirror debit here we store the category code for the depositories' charge to the client. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Category Code.
properties.name: DP_FOR_CATEGORY

properties.documentation: Depository Foreign Charge Debit transaction code to be utilised by the SYSTEM when processing Redemption transactions. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: DP_FOR_DR_CODE

properties.documentation: Suspense Account for depository posting to be used while processing Redemption transactions. Effectively a suspense or wash account for all Redemption Nostro entries. Until all entries for on Bond Redemption are authorised the Depository entry will not be posted to the nostro concerned. Validation Rules4-10 type 'AAA'(uppercase or lowercase alpha) characters. Mandatory input.Must exist as a valid Account Class.
properties.name: DEPO_SUSP_ACC

properties.documentation: It is anticipated that where the User advises Clients' of an early redemption by means of a PRE-ADVICE the Stock concerned will be attributed a different suffix number. T24 will recognise -234 as an early Redemption Type Security which cannot therefore be re-sold. Addition to a valid security number of '-234'. To prevent a Client or Account Officer Reselling stock which has been effectively 'Drawn' a separate Security position will be created for the 'Drawn stock'. Note: For all early redemptions a user will first have to open a new Security (the copy function can be used) and it can be titled "Early Redemption". Two positions will be shown on a Client's valuation - although no financial entries will be passed until the Bonds are actually redeemed. Validation RulesMandatory input.
properties.name: SECURITY_SUFFIX

properties.documentation: Standard Commission rate to be applied to Customers for Redemption type transactions Standard Commission rates are normally published by a Banks' Portfolio Managers and where a commission is indicated for Bond Redemptions that rate can be stored once and for all. '0.00' is allowed to cater for no change on Redemption Type Transactions. Validation Rules0-5 characters Standard Rate format. Mandatory input.
properties.name: COMMISSION_LEVEL

properties.documentation: Maximum Charge Indicator. The system will utilise Field 13 for calculating commission but where it exceeds Field 14 the amount is Field 14 i.e. the maximum charge will be displayed. Validation Rules0-5 characters Standard Rate format. Mandatory input.
properties.name: COMM_HIGHER_RATE

properties.documentation: Minimum Charge indicator. Where the commission calculated for this Redemption, using the rate stored in Field 13 falls below this amount the System will default to this Minimum Charge. Validation Rules0-5 characters Standard Rate format. Mandatory input.
properties.name: COMM_LOWER_RATE

properties.documentation: Category code used for the change apportioned to the Client in Fields 13, 14 and 15. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).Must exist as a valid Category Code.
properties.name: CL_CHG_CATEGORY

properties.documentation: Transaction Code used in conjunction with Field 16 to indicate for P and L purposes the category and transaction used in creating the commission amount. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: CL_CHG_CR_CODE

properties.documentation: Stores the Category Code for the Depository Charge (Foreign Charge) applicable on a Redemption Transaction. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input)Must exist as a valid Category Code.
properties.name: DP_CHG_CATEGORY

properties.documentation: The transaction code used to signify what type of transaction has created the category entry it relates to for the depository charge on Redemption transactions. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: DP_CHG_DR_CODE

properties.documentation: Specifies the category code to be used for the posting of exchange Profit & Loss entries. This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's position. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999.Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_CAT

properties.documentation: The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Profits. To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following range has been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_CR_CD

properties.documentation: The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Losses. To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following range has been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_DB_CD

properties.documentation: Validation RulesA maximum of 16 characters may be entered.
properties.name: FGN_CHG_TAX_CODE

properties.documentation: The Profit and Loss category to which reallowanced entries are to be posted is defined in this field for use within the REDEMPTION.CUS application. Validation RulesMust be a valid P & L category (50000 - 59999).pMandatory Input.
properties.name: REALLOWANCE_PL_CAT

properties.documentation: This field holds the transaciton code which will be used for credit transactions arising from reallowance processing of bond redemptions. Validation RulesMust be a valid record on the TRANSACTION file.Mandatory Input.
properties.name: REALLOWANCE_PL_CR

properties.documentation: This field is used to specify the debit transaction code which will be used for reallowance transactions within the REDEMPTION.CUS application. Validation RulesMust be a valid record on the TRANSACTION file.Mandatory Input.
properties.name: REALLOWANCE_PL_DB

properties.documentation: Specifies "Own Account Trading/Investment" portfolio.Validation RulesY or blank
properties.name: DEALER_BOOK
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values which will be used when processing bond lending transactions. These defaults will be applicable irrespective of the transaction type and the user must create one record for each company on the system.
classes.name: SC_STD_BOND_LEND

properties.documentation: Specifies the Company to which the User must be Signed On in order to use the Application. Validation Rules9 alphanumeric characters 'CCGGGLLLL' where: CC is 2 alpha characters Country Code GGG is 3 numeric characters Company Group LLLL is 4 numeric local code. or 2-3 type MNE (uppercase alphanumeric or '.') Company Mnemonic characters. Mandatory input. No Default Value.
properties.name: COMPANY_CODE

properties.documentation: Default transaction code for all security credit type transactions within this application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).Must exist as a valid Transaction Code
properties.name: CR_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Default transaction code for all security debit type entries within this application. The following ranges have been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. To facilitate the recognition of the Transaction code number with the Application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each Application as specified in the details. (Mandatory input).Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: DB_TRANS_CODE

properties.documentation: Standard default category code for all charges levied from a client within this application. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters: a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory Input).Must exist as a valid Category code.
properties.name: CUST_CHARGE_CAT

properties.documentation: Default category code for all depository P&L entries processed within this application. This code classifies profit and loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's operation. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters. a) Product/P&L classification in the range 1-99. b) Sub-classification of product/P&L in the range 000-999. (Mandatory input).Must exist as a valid Category code.
properties.name: DEPT_CHARGE_CAT

properties.documentation: Specifies the category code to be used for the posting of exchange Profit & Loss entries. This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's position. Validation Rules4 or 5 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999.Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_CAT

properties.documentation: The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Profits. To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following range has been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_CR_CD

properties.documentation: The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Losses. To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application. The following range has been assigned within T24: 600 - 649 = Securities. Validation Rules1-3 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
properties.name: EXCHANGE_PL_DB_CD
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: Compound key consisting of INVESTMENT.PROGRAM key and MANAGED.ACCOUNT key, separated with an asterisk.
properties.name: RISK_CLASS_KEY

properties.documentation: Validated against EB.LOOKUP 'RISK.LEVEL'.
properties.name: RISK_LEVEL
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: This table contains company level default values that must be set up for the Securities module to run correctly. These defaults will apply irrespective of the application, transaction type, or user. One record must be created for each company running the Securities module.
classes.name: SC_PARAMETER

properties.documentation: Specifies the COMPANY to which the user must be signed on in order to use the application. Validation Rules 9 Alphanumeric characters in the format CCGGGLLLL where: CC is a 2 alpha character COUNTRY code. GGG is a 3 numeric character COMPANY code. LLLL is a 4 numeric character local code or 2-3 numeric company mnemonic characters or 2-3 uppercase alpha numeric company mnemonic characters. (Mandatory Input)
properties.name: COMPANY

properties.documentation: Specifies the product category to be used as a default if system is unable to use the specified product category for any reason. If the user has failed to enter a CATEGORY code in the SC.TRANS.TYPE table then the system will use the value defined in this field instead. Prior to release 11.0.0 this value was hard coded as 22-999. Validation Rules 4 or 5 Numeric characters. (Mandatory Input) Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
properties.name: DEFAULT_PRODUCT

properties.documentation: Specifies the default currency market that will be used to calculate all foreign exchange values in the Securities Module. The user may choose to define different exchange rates for different currency markets. (e.g. 1 is the T.T. rate 2 might be the rate for notes and coin etc). This field defines the currency market to be used in all foreign exchange transactions within the Securities module. The default value for this field is 1. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Numeric characters. (Optional Input) Must be numeric. Must exist on the CURRENCY.MARKET table.
properties.name: DEFAULT_CCY_MARKET

properties.documentation: The number of days back the application RESEQ.TRN.DATE can go to find securities transactions for resequencing when resequencing a security position. Validation Rules Optional numeric field allowing input of between 0 and 999 days.
properties.name: RESEQUENCE_DAYS

properties.documentation: Indicates whether or not the COMPANY is involved in FUND type operations. This field is reserved for future use. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Alphabetic characters. (Mandatory Input) This field can only have the values YES or NO.
properties.name: FUND

properties.documentation: Defines whether or not a depository advice is to be produced when dividends are received. If the Securities module is to produce a depository advice on receipt of a dividend then the user should enter YES in this field, otherwise they should enter NO. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Alphabetic characters. (Mandatory Input) This field can only contain the values YES or NO.
properties.name: DIV_DEPO_ADVICE

properties.documentation: Defines whether or not the DIV.COUP.CUS application should do its accounting at end of day to save time during on-line mode. If the DIV.COUP.CUS application is to do its accounting at end of day then the user should enter YES in this field, otherwise they should answer NO. Validation Rules 1 - 3 Alphabetic characters. (Mandatory Input) This field can only contain the values YES or NO.
properties.name: DIV_EOD_ACCT_POST

properties.documentation: Specifies the company specific valuation sub-routine that will be used to produce the customer or internal valuation reports as defined in the CUSTOMER.SECURITY, SEC.ACC.MASTER or OL.VAL.REPS applications. Since every bank is likely to have special requirements vis-a-vis the layout of its valuation reports, this field will allow the easy implementation of different reports at different T24 sites and even for different companies on the same machine. If no value is entered is this field then the system will use the default valuation sub-routine SC.ASSET.VAL.REPORTS. If the company is entered (XXXX) this will default to SC.ASSET.VAL.REPORTS.XXXX. Validation Rules 1 - 27 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional Input) Must exist as a Verb in the VOC.
properties.name: VALUATION_SUBR

properties.documentation: Defines whether the cost of position fields in the SECURITY.POSITION application will be maintained on a trade date or a value date basis. If the user enters Trade.Date in this field then the COST.INVST.SEC.CCY, COST.INVST.REF.CCY and COST.INVST.BSE.CCY fields will be maintained in trade date order, whereas if the user enters Value.Date in this field then they will be maintained in value date order. If nothing is entered in this field the cost of position will be maintained in trade date order. Validation Rules 1 - 10 Alphabetic characters. (Optional Input) Only TRADE.DATE, VALUE.DATE, or null can be entered in this field.
properties.name: RECALC_COST

properties.documentation: Specifies the country specific subroutine used to calculate Stamp tax and/or Cantonal tax and EBV fees where applicable. Since every country is likely to have its own unique tax rules, the use of this field will allow easy implementation of those different tax rules at sites in different countries. If the country code of the T24 user is entered (XX), it will then default to SC.SE.CALC.LOCAL will be used to carry out the calculations. Validation Rules 0 - 27 Alphanumeric characters (Optional input) Must exist as a Verb in VOC.
properties.name: TAX_SUBROUTINE

properties.documentation: Indicates whether stamp tax will be posted in Local or Foreign currency. If the user enters YES in this field then Stamp Tax and EBV Fees on a trade will be collected in the currency of the trade, and posted in Local currency. If, however, this is left blank then the flag on the file STK.EXC.LOCAL will be used. Validation Rules 0 - 3 Alphabetic characters (Optional input) Only the values YES, NO or null can be entered in this field.
properties.name: STAMPTAX_LOCAL_CCY

properties.documentation: This field defines the rounding factor to be used for calculating the deal amount on which Cantonal tax will be calculated. Example: If a SEC.TRADE on a bond is done where the gross amount of the trade was CHF1000 and the interest amount was CHF45. Assuming that the user had extered 1000 in this field then the total deal amount of CHF1045 would be rounded up to CHF2000 before the Cantonal tax rate was applied. Validation Rules 0 - 10 Numeric characters (Optional input)
properties.name: CANTONAL_ROUNDING

properties.documentation: Certain companies may be exempt stock exchange (EBV) fees for various reasons in various countries. (e.g. Finance companies are exempt EBV fees when trading on their local exchange in Switzerland) This field defines whether or not the COMPANY is exempt EBV fees. If the user enters YES in this field then the TAX.SUBROUTINE will not calculate EBV fees. Validation Rules 2 or 3 Alphabetic characters (Mandatory Input) Only the values YES or NO are allowed in this field.
properties.name: EXEMPT_EBV_FEES

properties.documentation: Defines the STOCK EXCHANGE where the COMPANY usually trades. If the company is resident in Geneva then they usually trade on the Geneva stock exchange, thus they should enter 003, (The Telekurs number for the Geneva stock exchange) in this field. Also if the local stock exchange is the same as the stock exchange on the trade and the securities customer is a Swiss resident and an Effektenhaendler then there are no EBV fees. Validation Rules one to five Alphanumeric characters Mandatory Input Must exist on the STOCK.EXCHANGE table.
properties.name: LOCAL_STOCK_EXCH

properties.documentation: If this field is set to Yes, Stock exchange in SEC.OPEN.ORDER would be defaulted based on the stock exchange specified in SECURITY.MASTER. Validation Rules YES/NO are the accepted values
properties.name: DEFAULT_STOCK_EXCH

properties.documentation: This is a non-input field which will be released at a future date.
properties.name: PRICE_TYPE

properties.documentation: Defines to message number to be used by SEC.OPEN.ORDER confirmations. This field is used to define which message will be produced by SEC.OPEN.ORDER as a confirmation. If 599 or 999 is input then the message concerned will be produced by delivery. If 500/501 is input then no SEC.OPEN.ORDER confirmation will be produced. Validation Rules Input must be 599 or 999 or 500/501 Input is mandatory and must be either 500, 999 or 500/501. Currently there is no default.
properties.name: OPN_ORD_MAP

properties.documentation: This field controls whether or not forward accounting entries are generated by SEC.OPEN.ORDER. Allows NONE, NO, Y and UNAUTH NO or NONE - This setting indicates no accounting entries will be generated at any stage of the process. UNAUTH - This setting allows STMT.ENTRY records to be generated at the unauthorised stage. Suitable ACCOUNT balance messages and the appropriate OVERRIDE messages will be generated. Y - This setting produces suitable ACCOUNT balance messages and the appropriate OVERRIDE messages will be stored on the transaction. However, STMT.ENTRY records will only be generated at authorization stage.
properties.name: OPN_ORD_FWD_ACCT

properties.documentation: This field specifies the number of months that performance details for the SEC.ACC.MASTER record will be retained by the system. The default value for this field is 13 months, this also being the minimum allowed value. The maximum being 99 months. Validation Rules 2 numeric characters.
properties.name: PERFORM_MONTHS

properties.documentation: This is a YES/NO flag designed to allow the user to specify whether they want securities held in different depositories to be shown as such on portfolio valuations reports and sceens. Validation Rules Input of YES or NO only allowed. Defaults to NO.
properties.name: SEP_DEPOSITORY

properties.documentation: YES/NO flag to allow the bank to specify whether they want to allow transactions to be entered where the nominal of the securities on the customer side is not exactly divisible by the number of trading units or not. If this field is set to YES then if a Securities transaction is entered where the number of nominal on the customer side is not exactly divisible by the number of trading units for the Security concerned an override will result. The broker side will never allow the input of a nominal figure that is not exactly divisible by the number of trading units of the Security. If the field is set to NO all nominals entered must be exactly divisible by the number of Trading Units defined on the SECURITY.MASTER record for the Security Concerned. Validation Rules Input restricted to YES or NO.
properties.name: OVER_TRADE_UNIT

properties.documentation: Field controlling whether or not the bank wants to be able to produce portfolio valuation reports through the Enquiry system or not. Input of YES in this field builds the data files used to produce portfolio valuation reports through Enquiry. Validation Rules Only input of YES or NO allowed. Defaults to NO.
properties.name: SOFT_PORTFOLIO

properties.documentation: Using this field user can define an ALTERNATE INDEX for the system other than SECURITY.NO. Allowed values for alternate index are (1) I.S.I.N. (2) EUROCLEAR.NO (3) CEDEL.NO (4) SEDOL.NO (5) SWISS.NO (6) CUSIP.NO Validation Rules 12 character alphanumeric Optional input.
properties.name: ALTERNATE_INDEX

properties.documentation: YES/NO flag to allow the bank to specify whether they want to display the total customer nominal entered to be displayed in the top right hand corner of the SEC.OPEN.ORDER application or not. If YES is entered into this field then the total customer nominal entered for the order will be displayed in the top right hand corner of the SEC.OPEN.ORDER application. Validation Rules Input restricted to YES or NO.
properties.name: DISPLAY_ORD_NOM

properties.documentation: Field that allows the user to define the format of the ID of the SECURITY.MASTER file. Input is designed to be of a ######-### type format. Validation Rules No change field. Will default to ######-### Input must consist of only #s and -s. Where each # will represent a number on the actual ID. Maximum length of Input is 12. Minimum will be of 4 #s.
properties.name: SECURITY_FORMAT

properties.documentation: YES/NO flag controlling whether tax calculated on dividends generated by the corporate actions suite of programs will post tax (YES) or simply record the amounts for information (NO). Validation Rules Input must be either YES or NO. Mandatory input. Will default to YES.
properties.name: POST_DIV_TAX

properties.documentation: Defines whether the outstanding amount and the outstanding nominal amount will be defaulted into the SEC.DEL.CONTROL record. Input of YES will cause the amounts to be defaulted. If this field is set to YES then any SEC.DEL.CONTROL record where there is no money or securities outstanding will automatically be authorised. If the value of this field is changed to YES then any unauthorised SEC.DEL.CONTROL records where there is no money or securities outstanding will be authorised. Validation Rules Input of YES or NO allowed No input will be treated as NO
properties.name: DEF_DEL_CONTROL

properties.documentation: YES or NO flag to allow the bank to specify whether they want corporate action financial postings produced by the ENTITLEMENT application that have a foreign exchange component to have the number of spot days that are defined on the FX.PARAMETERS file added to the value date or not. YES will result in the spot days being added to the value date. Validation Rules Input restricted to YES or NO. Will default to NO.
properties.name: CORP_ACTN_FX_SPOT

properties.documentation: Controls which Account balance to use when carrying out cash availability checks for portfolios in the ORDER.BY.CUST application. If this field is set to ONLINE then the ONLINE balance of the account will be used. If this field is set to FORWARD then the balance used will include forward entries. Validation Rules Only input of FORWARD or ONLINE allowed. Mandatory Input. Will default to ONLINE
properties.name: AC_ORDER_BAL

properties.documentation: This field identifies the maximum number of dividends for which details are retained on the SECURITY.SUPP for the purpose of calculating yields. If no input is made then details of all dividends will be retained. Validation Rules Optional input Any input made must be numeric.
properties.name: MAX_DIVIDEND

properties.documentation: This field controls whether the value of the PAR.VALUE of a security (as set-up in the PAR.VALUE field on SECURITY.MASTER) is used in the calculation of the interest amount for bonds or not. If this field is set to YES then the par value of a bond will be included in any interest amount calculation. For example, if a bond has a par value of 2.00 dollars, an interest day basis of 360/360, an interest rate of 10 %, and two equal payments a year then the interest amount for a portfolio holding 100,000 bonds for a half year (180 days) payment is AMOUNT = (180 * 10.00 * 100,000 * 2) --------------------------- (360 * 100) If this field is set to NO then the value of the PAR.VALUE field is ignored and for the example given above the interest amount will be calculated AMOUNT = (180 * 10.00 * 100,000) ----------------------- (360 * 100) Validation Rules Only input of YES or NO allowed. Will default to NO.
properties.name: PAR_VALUE_INT

properties.documentation: This field controls whether the current yield or the yield to maturity is used in the update of Sc.Cash.Flow and Sc.Pos.Asset. If this field is set to 1 then the yield to maturity will be used from the Security.Supp record. If this field is set to 2 then the current yield will be used from the Security.Supp record. See the helptext for Sc.Pos.Asset, yield, for a more detailed explanation Validation Rules Only input of 1 or 2 allowed. Will default to 1.
properties.name: YIELD_TYPE

properties.documentation: If the bank wishes to use the Corporate Actions system to process their bond redemptions this field will contain the ID of the DIARY.TYPE that they will use to process redemptions. If this field has been updated then DIARY records will automatically be created by EOD.REDEM.AUT.REQ instead of REDEMPTION.DET records. Validation Rules Must exist on the DIARY.TYPE file. Optional Input. If a DIARY.TYPE ID is entered here then the DIARY.TYPE record must be a CASH only record that does not retain the original holding.
properties.name: REDEMPTION_TYPE

properties.documentation: Mandatory field controlling whether or not accrued interest us included in the calculation of month end balances for Safecustody Fees and Advisory Charges. If this field is set to YES then any accrued interest for the portfolio will be included in the calculation of the month end balances used in the calculation of Safecustody Fees and Advisory Charges. If this field is set to NO or left blank then any accrued interest for the portfolio will be ignored when calculating the month end balance for the portfolio. Validation Rules Mandatory field. Only input of YES or NO allowed. If no input has been made then the system will default NO.
properties.name: CHG_INCLUDE_INT

properties.documentation: Mandatory field controlling whether or not short positions are included in the calculation of month end balances for Safecustody Fees and Advisory Charges. If this field is set to YES then the short positions contained upon a portfolio will be debited from the month end balances used in the calculation of Safecustody Fees and Advisory Charges. If this field is set to NO or left blank then any short positions contained upon a portfolio will be ignored when calculating the month end balance for the portfolio. Validation Rules Mandatory field. Only input of YES or NO allowed. If no input has been made then the system will default NO.
properties.name: CHG_INCLUDE_SHORT

properties.documentation: This field allows the user to specify how unauthorised transactions are dealt with in the portfolio valuation. If set to YES then unauthorised transactions will appear on the valuation. If set to NO or blank then unauthorised transactions will not appear on the valuation, irrespective of whether an authorised record exists. If set to AUTH then the authorised value of the transaction will be included on the valuation. Note that changes where the customer is deleted or the portfolio changed are not included on the valuation for this setting. Validation Rules Valid input YES, NO or AUTH. Default NO.
properties.name: INCLUDE_NAU_TXNS

properties.documentation: Defines the message number to be used to send a Broker Confirmation. This may either be 512 or 518. This field is used to determine whether an MT512 or MT518 is sent for a Broker Confirmation. Please note that an MT512 may only be sent by members of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority If this field is left blank, an MT512 will be assumed. Validation Rules Input may be 512, 518 or blank
properties.name: BROKER_MSG_TYPE

properties.documentation: Defines the name of the routine which produces an alternative safekeeping journal report Validation Rules Optional Input Must exist in PGM.FILE as a TYPE S record
properties.name: SAFEKEEP_REPORT

properties.documentation: This field defines the method to use when calculating the margin value. This may be by asset only or by both asset and liability. Where ASSET is entered, all asset margin values will be calculated using the respective MARGIN.RATE in either ASSET.TYPE, SUB.ASSET.TYPE or ASSET.BY.CATEG and liability values will be 0. Where BOTH is entered, the asset value will be calculated as stated above and the liability value will be calculated using the LOSS.MARGIN.RATE from ASSET.TYPE, SUB.ASSET.TYPE or ASSET.BY.CATEG Where this field is left blank, both asset and liability values will be calculated based on the MARGIN.RATE field. Validation Rules Input must be ASSET, BOTH or null
properties.name: MARGIN_VALUE

properties.documentation: This is a flag that will be used to indicate to the system when or not dealer books will trade in bonds with factors. Validation Rules Optional Input valid inputs are YES or NO Null corresponds to NO
properties.name: USE_BONDS_WTH_FTRS

properties.documentation: This field decides whether the Capital Gains Base is updated or not. A value of YES or RULES indicates that the system will maintain the CG base and otherwise it will not. Validation Rules Valid values YES, RULES or NO Null is treated like NO
properties.name: CG_BASE_UPDATE

properties.documentation: Denotes the default setting for delivery suppression advices in SEC.TRADE SECURITY.TRANSFER. Validation Rules YES or NO
properties.name: ADVICE_DEFAULT

properties.documentation: This is a flag that will be used to facilitate Actual or Contractual Settlement. If this field is set to YES, then it would be Actual Settlement. Optional Input valid inputs are YES or NO Null corresponds to NO
properties.name: ACTUAL_SETTLEMENT

properties.documentation: Input the number of days after a SC.SETTLEMENT has been completely settled that it will be written to history. Once the settlement record has been moved to history it will not be possible to reverse the underlying transaction. Validation Rules 3 numeric characters.
properties.name: SETT_MAT_DAYS

properties.documentation: Defines the local reference field that can be used in entitlement instructions, security constraints AND investment programs to categorise securities
properties.name: PRODUCT_TYPE

properties.documentation: A check to determine whether issuer limits are to be updated with nominal or traded amount. Validation Rules Accepted values are CASH and NOMINALS.
properties.name: UPDATE_LIMIT

properties.documentation: The suspense account to be credited/debited for customer amount due in respect of actual settlement trades pending settlement of trade. Validation Rules Valid category in Range - 10000 to 19999.
properties.name: CUST_ACT_SUSP_CAT
en
properties.value: Suspense account to post customer cash amount

properties.documentation: Used as a category reference for the broker amount to be deferred. The suspense amount of the broker is posted to it. Validation Rules The value in this field should be a valid record existing in CATEGORY file.
properties.name: BROK_ACT_SUSP_CAT
en
properties.value: Broker suspense account to post suspense amount

properties.documentation: Used as a category reference for miscellaneous items such as commission. The suspense amounts of miscellaneous items are posted to it. Validation Rules The value in this field should be a valid record existing in CATEGORY file.
properties.name: MISC_ACT_SUSP_CAT

properties.documentation: This field is input able only when the settlement field is used, ACTUAL.SETTLEMENT field. This field has two options YES or NO. YES enables the suppression of the forward entries. That is, there will not be a STMT.ENTRY with a prefix F or a Forward dated entry when the Settlement is involved.
properties.name: SUP_ACT_FWD_ENT

properties.documentation: It controls the number of Permissions to be met to allow a transaction to be completedSingle - If single permission is met, will allow the transaction to completeBlank or Null - All permissions should be met, to allow the transaction to complete
properties.name: GRANT_PERMISSION

properties.documentation: Used to control to retention of SC.PRE.DIARY records. If not set SC.PRE.DIARY records will be retained for 180 working days.
properties.name: DIARY_REMAIN

properties.documentation: This field controls the grouping method to be used and allows the values MANUAL, AUTOMATIC or BOTH. If this field is left blank (none), then grouping of orders will not be allowed. If manual or automatic is selected then TRANSMIT.ORDER field in SC.STD.SEC.TRADE must be set to Yes. Also, if MANUAL is selected, an OFS.SOURCE and OFS.VERSION for SC.GROUP.ORDERS should be defined and linked in SC.STD.SEC.TRADE. Additionally, if AUTOMATIC is selected, an OFS.SOURCE and OFS.VERSION for SEC.OPEN.ORDER should also be defined and linked in SC.STD.SEC.TRADE. These versions would be used for generation and update of Grouped Sec.Open.Order through OFS. Validation Rules Appropriate version of SC.GROUP.ORDERS Appropriate version of SEC.OPEN.ORDER besides that of SC.GROUP.ORDERS
properties.name: GROUP_ORDER

properties.documentation: Specifies the length in working days that a Blocking record will remain in the live file of SC.BLOCK.SEC.POS before being moved to the History file by the End of Day processing. Validation Rules 0 to 999 working days
properties.name: BLOCK_HISTORY

properties.documentation: Portfolio ID of the suspense portfolio to be used in orporate action processing when original portfolios are closed. Validation Rules Must be a valid SEC.ACC.MASTER record with memo account
properties.name: SUSP_PORTFOLIO

properties.documentation: Intended for future use.
properties.name: STP

properties.documentation: This Field should be used to specify whether the Source Tax should be shown as a separate accounting entry in the Customer account. The Customer will be posted with the Gross amount and a separate Source Tax amount. This split applies only to the accounting generated from ENTITLEMENT. The System will default to this field for Source Tax entries. Validation Rules Optional Input. Input can be YES, No or left Blank. Blank is equivalent to NO.
properties.name: SOURCE_TAX_SPLIT

properties.documentation: This Field should be used to specify whether the Local Tax should be shown as a separate accounting entry in the Customer account. The Customer will be posted with the Gross amount and a separate Local Tax amount. This split applies only to the accounting generated from ENTITLEMENT. The System will default to this field for Local Tax entries. Validation Rules Optional Input. Input can be YES, No or left Blank. Blank is equivalent to NO.
properties.name: LOCAL_TAX_SPLIT

properties.documentation: Flag controlling whether Custodian Depository in SEC.OPEN.ORDER should be defaulted or not. Validation Rules Only input of YES or NO is allowed. Optional Input.
properties.name: DEF_CUST_DEPO

properties.documentation: This field allows input of value US. This field controls the Special Processing such as Generation of Broker Positions Generation of SC.STOCK.ENTRY to record each position movement. (Refer to STOCK.RECORD functionality in User Guide for detailed information) Validation Rules Input allowed only if ACTUAL. SETTLEMENT field is set to YES
properties.name: SETTLE_METHOD
en
properties.value: Indicates the settle method for the payment type

properties.documentation: Input allowed are YES or NO. If the input is YES, the search of Security Master IDs by DESCRIPTION is enabled. Input to field SEC.DESC.ENQUIRY becomes mandatory. If the input is NO, then the field SEC.DESC.ENQUIRY will become NOINPUT.
properties.name: SEC_DESC_SEARCH

properties.documentation: Enquiry name is attached here. The record name should be a valid input in Enquiry file. The enquiry, which would search the Securities by the Alternate Index, should be attached here.
properties.name: SEC_NO_ENQUIRY

properties.documentation: Enquiry name is attached here. The record name should be a valid input in Enquiry file. The enquiry, which would search the Securities by the DESCRIPTION, should be attached here. Validation Rules Mandatory when field SEC.DESC.SEARCH is YES.
properties.name: SEC_DESC_ENQUIRY

properties.documentation: During the execution of trading restriction testing (configured in SC.SECURITY.CONSTRAINT) many restrictions may be tested. This field allows the following settings SINGLE - Once one restriction test has failed, the restriction testing program will return control back to the main application. MULTIPLE - Each restriction test that fails will be displayed to the user in turn, therefore if 20 tests fail the user will see 20 error messages. Validation Rules SINGLE, MULTIPLE or NULL. (If NULL the systems assumes SINGLE mode)
properties.name: CONSTRAINT_FAILURE

properties.documentation: Field indicates whether charges, accrued interest and taxes are to be calculated when SEC.TRADE record is created from SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS (transmitted orders) and SEC.OPEN.ORDER (traded orders). Validation Rules YES or NO field. Blank would be considered NO.
properties.name: CALC_ST_CHGS_IHLD

properties.documentation: This field will allow input to field SC.TRANS.NAME if set to YES;. Default is NO. By setting the field to YES, the user is declaring that any SECURITY.TRANSFERS with transaction codes defined on SC.TRANS.NAME are free transfers. Validation Rules
properties.name: SECT_PEND

properties.documentation: Used in the corporate actions service to automatically populate entitlement records using AUT.NEW.CONTENT (APIs and subroutines only).
properties.name: ENT_INP_VERSION

properties.documentation: This field allows accruing the dividends in the NET.ACCRUED.DIV and ORIG.ACCR.DIV fields of SC.POS.ASSET file. The process can be done at the event type level also. If the dividends are accrued in the SC.POS.ASSET fields, the ENTITLEMENT value is reflected in the valuations for the period between Ex Date and Payment (or value) Date. Validation Rules Input field the values authorized are GROSS, NET, or null.
properties.name: DIV_ACCR_TYPE

properties.documentation: Allows the user to specify how the captial gains indexation values have been entered in the COUNTRY and REGION applications. Can be either ES, indicating that the values entered are indexation coefficients, or STD, indicating that the values are index values. For example - ES The current dates value is entered as 1 and preceding values increase (generally due to inflation) STD A base date (some past date) value is expressed as 100 and all dates forward of this are expressed as increasing values (again due to inflation). Validation Rules Optional Input, if not entered will be assumed to be STD.
properties.name: INFL_INDX_METH

properties.documentation: Specifies whether Balance Movement related data needs to be maintained for Security transactions in Customer Portfolios. A value in this field would be relevant only if the Balance Movement related data is specified for maintenance for SC or ALL applications in the field BAL.MVMT.APPS of MI.PARAMETER. Validation Rules Valid values are YES/NO.
properties.name: BUILD_CUS_PORT

properties.documentation: No-input field which contains the Last Archived Date of TRN.CON.DATE file. This will be used for validation purposes in the application level i.e.Transactions cannot have a trade date falling before this date.
properties.name: LAST_ARCH_DATE

properties.documentation: Can be used to stop the updates to the old portfolio modelling files when a valuation is run.
properties.name: USE_OLD_PORT_MODEL

properties.documentation: Reserved for future use Validation Rules NOINPUT
properties.name: SHARED_SAM

properties.documentation: Reserved for future use Validation Rules NOINPUT
properties.name: SHARED_SOO_EXE

properties.documentation: Used by EOD.DIV.AUT.REQ when generating automatic diary events in the close of business
properties.name: DIARY_EOD_RTNE

properties.documentation: This field is used to specify whether the recoverable tax should be included in the valuation and performance calculation. CUM The recoverable Tax will be accumulated and shown in valuation files (SC.POS.ASSET and SC.VALUATION.EXTRACT) as field REC.TAX.CUM.AMT. This field will be reset to 0 when the Reset occurs through the EOD process EOD.RECOVERABLE.TAX. This option is only available if AM is installed. BOOK - The recoverable tax amount will be added to the valuation tables on the same day and will not be accumulated. Validation Rules field (A) field. Allowed values are CUM BOOK. If left Blank considered as BOOK.
properties.name: REC_TAX_ACCRUAL

properties.documentation: Used as the order type in SEC.OPEN.ORDER when a cash order is created from ORDER.BY.CUST.
properties.name: OBC_CASH_ORD_TYPE

properties.documentation: Used when automatically creating SEC.OPEN.ORDER records from ENTITLEMENT records. Mapped to ORDER.TYPE field in associated SEC.OPEN.ORDER.
properties.name: REINVEST_ORD_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field allows shares to be lent using the application BOND.LENT.MASTER. If left blank or set to NO then the use of shares will be blocked in BOND.LENT.MASTER, if set to YES then the use of shares will be allowed.
properties.name: SHARE_LENDING

properties.documentation: This is a flag that when set to YES the log file SC.TXNS.WHILE.COB will be updated. Valid inputs are YES or NULL
properties.name: UPDATE_NS_LOG

properties.documentation: Determines whether the settlement tolerance values will be posted to an internal account or to PL. Must be in the range 10000 to 19999 for an internal account or 50000 to 59999 for a PL category. Unless this field is set no postings will be made to settlement tolerances accounts or categories.
properties.name: SETT_TOL_CATEG

properties.documentation: Determines whether values greater than the settlement tolerance, as defined in each CUSTOMER.SECURITY record, will be posted to the tolerance category account or PL account. Can be YES, NO or blank, with YES indicating that values greater than the tolerance value will be posted. Unless SETT.TOL.CATEG is set this field will have no effect.
properties.name: OVERPOST_SETT_TOL

properties.documentation: This field allows the NAV to be recorded either NET or GROSS of transaction costs. When processing SEC.TRADE and SECURITY.TRANSFER records,it is possible to record the NAV either Net or Gross of transaction costs. If NET is selected then,the cost of the acquisition is NAV plus all charges and commissions, and the sale consideration is NAV minus charges and commissions. If GROSS is selected then charges and commissions are ignored. The difference between the cost of acquisition and sale consideration is considered as the Capital gain and taxed accordingly.
properties.name: NAV_TYPE

properties.documentation: Field used to determine whether CHF rounding is required or not. Value YES or null indicates that CHF rounding is required and current way of CHF rounding will be followed. Value NO will turn off CHF rounding
properties.name: CHF_ROUNDING

properties.documentation: Integer, up to 999, determines the number of seconds for which valuation data (SC.POS.ASSET) will be deemed as current before a rebuild is done. Currently not used. Reserved for future use.
properties.name: VALN_DATA_TIME

properties.documentation: This field determines the setting used when maintaining the earliest date for which transactions details are to be retained in SC.TRANS.POS.HISTORY. Any transaction falling before this date will be removed from the history. The field is a number of days and will default to 7300 if not set. This field should only be set on instruction from Temenos and only when the implications of setting it are understood.
properties.name: SCTP_BACK_VAL_MAX

properties.documentation: The value in the field will decide if the the accrued interest has to be calculated until the next working day so that SC.POS.ASSET record will reflect the accrued interest value accordingly. When this field contains the value NEXT.WORK.DAY, interest will be accrued until the Next working day.
properties.name: INCL_ACCR_INT

properties.documentation: Field to provide an option to switch off the calculations on closed customer portfolios in order to increase the performance of some of the securities related COB jobs listed below. EOD.PERFORM.UPDATE, SC.EOM.UPDATE and WRITE.SC.VAL.EXTRACT A portfolio will only be considered as closed if the following conditions apply, 1)Closure date in SEC.ACC.MASTER is less than the current system/bank date 2)If safekeeping fees are setup then the fees must be posted or zero in SAFEKEEP.HOLDING 3)If advisory fees are setup then the fees must be posted or zero in SC.ADVISORY.CHG This parameter will only apply to customer portfolios, dealer books will not be ignored. If this field is set to NO, any calculation on closed portfolios will be switched off.
properties.name: CALC_CLOSEDPORT

properties.documentation: Specifies the maximum number of intermediaries (agents) that can be used in SEC.TRADE SECURITY.TRANSFER. If this number is exceeded then an override message will be raised. If not set then the maximum number will assumed to be zero.
properties.name: INTERMEDIARY

properties.documentation: This field controls the running of the close of business job SC.EOD.EXCEPTION.LOG. Unless this field is set to YES the job will not run.
properties.name: UPD_COB_EXCEP_LOG

properties.documentation: Value in this field determines whether system will support generation of outbound MT536 message or not. It should be set to YES in order to allow for generation of the message. Validation Rules Allowed input is YES or NO. Optional input.
properties.name: PRODUCE_MT536

properties.documentation: Value in this field signifies the maximum the number of transactions that can be carried per message, provided it does not exceed the 10000 character limit set by SWIFT. If it exceeds 10000 characters, the message will be split. Input to this field is allowed only if PRODUCE.MT536 is set to YES. Validation Rules Optional input. Input must be numeric between 1 - 9999.
properties.name: MT536_MAX_NO_TXNS

properties.documentation: Value in this field determines whether system will support inbound MT548 message or not. It should be set to YES in order to allow inbound MT548 message. Validation Rules Allowed input is YES or null. Optional input.
properties.name: PROCESS_MT548_IN

properties.documentation: Used by ORDER.BY.CUST application to determine whether net open order positions are to be included or excluded in calculations of buy or sell nominals. If YES then open orders will be included, otherwise they will not.
properties.name: INC_OPEN_ORDERS

properties.documentation: Controls update of SEC.TRANS.INFO (for eu savings tax), set to NO to supress the update.
properties.name: SEC_TRANS_INFO

properties.documentation: Used to define whether records should be generated in the live file STOCK.ENTRY, which shows the movement for securities. Input in this field is only permitted where SETTLE.METHOD is set to US. Validation Rules YES if stock updates are required. Otherwise leave blank.
properties.name: UPD_STOCK_ENTRY

properties.documentation: Controls updates of daily concat file, SEC.TRADE delivery and supression of some concat file updates when set to Y.
properties.name: SC_LOCAL_TRADING

properties.documentation: If set to YES SC.VALUATION.EXTRACT is updated when AM module is not installed.
properties.name: UPD_VAL_EXTRACT

properties.documentation: Determines the maximum number of sub-valued lines permitted in the SEC.OPEN.ORDER>NARRATIVE field.If entered, the value must be in the range 1 to 999 inclusive.If this field is left blank then no maximum will be imposed.When choosing a setting for this field bear in mind that, if grouping orders, the resultant group order will collate the Narrative lines from the individual orders, and this field should reflect the maximum lines for such a combined record.Note that this setting does not apply to the fields DEAL.NARRATIVE and ACCT.NARRATIVE in the same application, which are restricted to a maximum of 3 lines.
properties.name: MAX_SOO_NARR

properties.documentation: Determine whether external transaction is allowed. Allowed value is YES
properties.name: EXTERNAL_TXN

properties.documentation: Suspense category to be used for external transaction in order to raise entry in the broker side and can be only contingent Validation Rules Input allowed only if EXTERNAL.TXN is set to YES and is mandatory if EXTERNAL.TXN is set to YES
properties.name: EXT_SUSP_CAT

properties.documentation: Default external custodian to be used if custodian is unknown at transaction level.
properties.name: EXT_CUSTODIAN

properties.documentation: Determine whether Inhouse dealing is allowed.Allowed value is YES
properties.name: IN_HOUSE_DEALING

properties.documentation: Determines whether IMPAIRMENT is enabled. Allowed value is YES
properties.name: IMPAIRMENT

properties.documentation: Determines Profit and loss category to be posted for impairment. Validation Rules Input allowed only if IMPAIRMENT is set to YES and is mandatory if IMPAIRMENT is set to YES
properties.name: IMPAIRMENT_CATEG
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

properties.documentation: The customer number(s) of the bank acting as a broker on its own or its customers behalf. When the bank acts as a broker either on its own behalf or on behalf of its customers, the user should enter the customer number(s) of the bank as it operates in this regard. Validation Rules 1 - 6 Numeric customer numbers or 3-10 alpha numeric customer mnemonic characters. (Multivalue field) (Optional Input) Must exist on the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file with the CUSTOMER.TYPE field having a value of Broker.
properties.name: BANK_BROKER_NO

properties.documentation: The customer number(s) of the bank acting as depository on its own or its customers behalf. When the bank acts as a depository on its own behalf, or on behalf of its customers, the user should enter the customer number(s) of the bank as it operates in this regard. Validation Rules 1 - 6 Numeric customer numbers or 3 - 10 alphanumeric customer mnemonic characters. (Multivalue field) (Optional Input) Must exist on the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file with the CUSTOMER.TYPE field having a value of Depository.
properties.name: BANK_DEPO_NO

properties.documentation: Defines whether, and for which modules, the Security valuation process will automatically assign deals for a customer which have not been specifically assigned to a portfolio to a default portfolio. This field will be used by valuations update module to determine the customers portfolio when receiving non-securities data. If a portfolio is not entered on the transaction then the system will assign a default depending on the application supplying the data and this being in this field and also ensuring the customer is also a Securities customer. Example If customer number 123456 has two portfolios, 123456-1 and 123456-2, and they do a FOREX trade in which the PORTFOLIO.NUMBER field is left blank then a If this field is left blank then the deal will not be included on any portfolio valuation for this customer. b If FX or ALL is entered in this field then T24 will default to the first portfolio it finds for this customer (123456-1) that has not been closed and include the deal on that valuation. If all portfolios for this customer are closed then the first portfolio will be assigned. Validation Rules 0 to 3 Alphabetic characters (Multi-value field) (Optional input) Only the following values are allowed: Null - No applications will default. ALL - All applications will default. MM, FX etc which will be validated against the APPLICATIONS field in the COMPANY record
properties.name: DEFAULT_SUFFIX

properties.documentation: Multi-valued field linked to the BULK.LIMIT field. Input into this field will be validated against the SC.TRANS.NAME file. Used to define the transaction codes for which the bulk processing proceedure will be invoked if the number of portfolios on the SEC.TRADE transaction is greater than the figure in the BULK.LIMIT field. Validation Rules Must exist on the SC.TRANS.NAME field.
properties.name: BULK_TRANSACT

properties.documentation: Multi-valued numeric field associated with the BULK.TRANSACT field. Allows the user to define the maximum number of portfolios on a SEC.TRADE using the transaction code in the associated BULK.TRANSACT field before bulk processing is invoked to write to disk. Validation Rules Input must be numeric. Input only allowed if something has been input in the associated BULK.TRANSACT field.
properties.name: BULK_LIMIT

properties.documentation: This field defines the Asset Type for which the Valuation Integrity Checks are to be performed. Any input must exist on the ASSET.TYPE file. Multi-valued field associated with the MAXIMUM.YIELD and MINIMUM.YIELD fields. Validation Rules Optional input. Any input must exist on the ASSET.TYPE file. If something has been entered in an associated YIELD.MAXIMUM or YIELD.MINIMUM field then this field becomes mandatory. YIELD.MINIMUM field then this field will be required.
properties.name: YIELD_ASSET

properties.documentation: Insert text here Validation Rules Rule 1 Rule 2
properties.name: YIELD_MAXIMUM

properties.documentation: This field defines the minimum yield for the Asset type defined in the YIELD.ASSET field. This value is used as the minimum allowable yield before the Valuation Integrity report SC.INTEGRITY reports an error. Only numeric input allowed. Multi-valued field associated with the YIELD.ASSET and MAXIMUM.YIELD fields. Validation Rules Optional input. Input only allowed if associated YIELD.ASSET has be entered, in which case an entry must be made in either this field or the YIELD.MAXIMUM field.
properties.name: YIELD_MINIMUM

properties.documentation: This field defines the Asset Type for which the Valuation Integrity Checks are to be performed on the Price Securities. Format : Valid Asset Type Code. (Optional Input)
properties.name: PRICE_ASSET

properties.documentation: This field defines the No. days between the Current date and the DATE.LAST.PRICE on the SECURITY.MASTER before a security with an ASSET.TYPE equal to the asset input into the associated PRICE.ASSET field is considered to have an old price and an error is reported by SC.INTEGRITY. Note : PRICE.ASSET PRICE.DAYS are associated Multivalues. Validation Rules Optional field. Numeric input only is allowed.
properties.name: PRICE_DAYS

properties.documentation: If the bank wishes to use the Corporate Actions system to process their coupons this field will contain the ID of the DIARY.TYPE that they will use to process coupon payments. If this field is entered then the system will cycle the INT.PAYMENT.DATE field on the SECURITY.MASTER record for the security concerned when a coupon is processed for the security. Also if this field has been updated then DIARY records will automatically be created by DIV.AUT.REQ and EOD.DIV.AUT.REQ instead of DIV.COUP.CUS records. Validation Rules Must exist on the DIARY.TYPE file. Optional Input. If a DIARY.TYPE ID is entered here then the DIARY.TYPE record must be a CASH only record.
properties.name: COUPON_TYPE

properties.documentation: Multi-value field to allow a user to define which countries are local. Validation Rules Will default to the Local Country defined on the COMPANY file.
properties.name: LOCAL_COUNTRY

properties.documentation: Insert text here Validation Rules Rule 1 Rule 2
properties.name: JOB_NAME

properties.documentation: Specifies the start of the date range within which transactions should be selected. This field is associated to JOB.NAME and must be entered. Note: This date will be automatically cycled during the Start of Day processing. Validation Rules 0 - 11 date characters. The year must be in the range 1950 - 2049
properties.name: START_DATE

properties.documentation: Specifies the end of the date range within which transactions should be selected. If entered, the date must be greater than the start date (entered in the previous field). This field is associated to JOB.NAME Note This date will be automatically cycled during the Start of Day processing. Validation Rules 0 - 11 date characters. The year must be in the range 1950 - 2049
properties.name: END_DATE

properties.documentation: Insert text here Validation Rules Rule 1 Rule 2
properties.name: MIN_HOLD_CHECK

properties.documentation: This field is used to to post the settlement accounting entries during Start of Day instead of during End of Day. Inputting ALL in this field will post all the settlement accounting entries during Start of day. Inputting nothing in this field will post the settlement accounting entries during End of Day. Currently this field only allows inputting ALL. This field is made as a multi value set for the future enhancement. Validation Rules If ALL is entered in this field then this field is not allowed for multivaluing.
properties.name: SOD_ACCTG

properties.documentation: The valuation application is used to define routines called to evaluate, modify and enter selected portfolio positions in the SC.POS.ASSET file. This field specifies the module code for which the associated routines are intended. This forms a multivalue set with fields USR.PORT.SEL.RTN and USR.POS.RTN. Purpose - These user defined routines are intended to give the flexibility to include or exclude contracts from a particular portfolio when updating the SC.POS.ASSET file for valuation purpose. In order to amend or make changes to the SC.POS.ASSET file, the user defined routines will be called from existing routines. USR.PORT.SEL.RTN routine will be invoked just prior standard search of customer contracts which are included in portfolio. USR.POS.RTN routine will be invoked just prior to the write statement on SC.POS.ASSET. The routine is passed the record of the SC.POS.ASSET after processing in the calling routine and just before the updating the SC.POS.ASSET file, the user can make the modifications to this record to his requirement and pass back the array to the calling routine. So the changes can be reflected in the SC.POS.ASSET file. If the VAL.APPL is SC then the USR.POS.RTN routine is passed the record of SC.POS.ASSET, after processing in the calling routine and just before the updating the SC.POS.ASSET file. But this routine doesnt overwrite the value calculated by the System. The USR.PORT.SEL.RTN routine is not triggered for SC application. Validation Rules 2 alpha character Module Code. Input must be one of the following AC, FD, FR, FX, DP(Deposits), MD, LC, RP,SW,SC (Optional input)
properties.name: VAL_APPL

properties.documentation: Specifies the user defined subroutine for the respective valuation application entered in field VAL.APPL. This form a multivalue set with field VAL.APPL USR.POS.RTN Purpose Invoked This routine Output array contains list of contracts which should be included in portfolio valuation. If the output array is empty the calling routine searchs for the list of contract Ids as it does usually (i.e. if array is empty SC.OL.VAL.FX reads CUSTOMER.FOREX file and looks for deals attached to this portfolio). Routine usage example EX.USR.PORT.SEL.RTN ( IN.PORTFOLIO, OUT.ID.LIST1, OUT.ID.LIST2, OUT.ID.LIST3) Where OUT.ID.LIST1 is list of contract Ids separated by Field marks (for example for application FOREX it will look as FX0110100001:@FM:FX0110100003.). OUT.ID.LIST2 This is used only in case if LC and represents the contract ids from LC.BENEFICIARY separated by Field marks. OUT.ID.LIST3 This is used only in case of LC and represents the contract ids from LC.ISSUING.BANK separated by Field marks. Validation Rules
properties.name: USR_POR_SEL_RTN

properties.documentation: Specifies the user defined subroutine for the respective valuating application entered in field VAL.APPL. Forms a multivalue set with field VAL.APPL and USR.PORT.SEL.RTN Purpose Invoked This user routine will be invoked just prior to the write statement on SC.POS.ASSET. The routine is passed the SC.POS.ASSET record, After processing in the calling routine and just before updating the SC.POS.ASSET file. The user can make the modifications to this record to his requirement and pass back the array to the calling routine. So the changes can be reflected in the SC.POS.ASSET file. The routine should be specified as EXAMPLE.ROUTINE(IN.SC.POS.ASSET.REC) Where IN.SC.POS.ASSET.REC contains the SC.POS.ASSET record. Validation Rules
properties.name: USR_POS_RTN

properties.documentation: SC.CLASS.TYPE and EB.CLASS.NO are used to formulate the class mapping between SC internal class and EB.MESSAGE.CLASS. The main driving concept of ACTIVITY and CLASS has lend itself to facilitate the user by automatically trigger only the message related to the operation, which user are currently do. In a sense, the system will try to default a sensible CLASS tiding to corresponding activity, and populate the information on the SC transaction. Consequently, the user can take control of the class to choose whether he/she wants to produce as per suggestion by the system. The following types are valid types: + BASIC.MESSAGE + NEW.MESSAGE + MODIFICATION + CANCELLATION + USER.DEFINE1 + USER.DEFINE2 + USER.DEFINE9 NEW.MESSAGE will be triggered for new SEC.OPEN.ORDER where CONFIRMATION is set to YES MODIFICATION will be triggered If there is a change in AMT.TO.BROKER field between R.NEW and R.OLD of SEC.OPEN.ORDER CANCELLATION will be triggered when SEC.OPEN.ORDER is reversed or BROKER is deleted from SEC.OPEN.ORDER If message class needs to be triggered irrespective of any condition then, message BASIC.MESSAGE and USER.DEFINE1 to USER.DEFINE9 will be used. Validation Rules Only the following values are allowed BASIC.MESSAGE NEW.MESSAGE MODIFICATION CANCELLATION USER.DEFINE1 USER.DEFINE2 USER.DEFINE3 USER.DEFINE4 USER.DEFINE5 USER.DEFINE6 USER.DEFINE7 USER.DEFINE8 USER.DEFINE9
properties.name: SC_CLASS_TYPE

properties.documentation: This field will be used in conjunction with the previous field to populate the class on the SC transaction. classes.documentation: Table type file which needs to be set up within the Static Information area of the Security's Module.It is essential that these records exist before the user attempts to process any transactions.The file is structured to indicate to both the user and the system the type of settlement procedure to be carried out on any individual transaction within the Module.It indicates whether securities are to received or delivered and if that delivery is free or against payment.The system will then utilise this information to create open records on the Sec.Del.Control file which is effectively a record of all open settlements awaiting stock and/or monetary consideration. This file plays an important role when formatting delivery instructions to the various Clearing houses such as CEDEL and EUROCLEAR. It helps to determine the type of message being sent and the information contained therein. The Sec.Trade application is coded in such a way that certain fields become mandatory depending on the type of delivery instruction entered.For a fuller description of the validation rules and the file dependencies covering these delivery codes see the Securities User Manual covering this area.
classes.name: SC_DEL_INSTR

properties.documentation: Unique reference which identifies the SC DEL INSTR.Validation Rules1-5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: DELIVERY_INSTR_CDE

properties.documentation: Specifies whether the transaction is of a type where Stock is to be either Received or delivered in the normal course of settlement.This transaction code is used within the Sec.Del.Control file to govern whether or not securities are expected to be delivered or received from the counterparty concerned. If set to "Y" then the Sec.Del.Control record will remain in an unauthorised state until securities are actually delivered and the nominal amount entered against the journal record.Validation RulesY = Yes, or N/NO = No. Only. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: TO_BE_RECD_OR_DEL

properties.documentation: Specifies whether (where this SC.DEL.INSTR is used) delivery is to be with payment or free of payment.If this field is set to "Y" within a given transaction payment is expected from the counterpart involved. The Sec.Del.Control application record for this transaction will remain in an unauthorised state until the amount of money to be received or paid matches that actually entered.Validation RulesY = Yes (delivery with payment), or N/NO = No (delivery free of payment), Only. (Mandatory input.)
properties.name: WITH_PAYMENT_FLAG

properties.documentation: Field to allow the user to define a delivery instruction that creates a SEC.DEL.CONTROL record for information purposes only. If YES is input into this field then when a transaction is input using delivery instruction a SEC.DEL.CONTROL record will be created without any checks being made to see if there is a delivery link.Validation RulesOptional inputOnly Input of YES or NO allowed.Leaving this field blank will be treated as NO.
properties.name: INFORMATION_ONLY

properties.documentation: Validation RulesA maximum of 2 characters may be entered.The following values are permitted: Y NO
properties.name: EXISTS_FLAG

properties.documentation: Validation RulesA maximum of 10 characters may be entered.The following values are permitted: DEPOSIT DEPOSITORY NOMINATIVE
properties.name: TYPE

properties.documentation: Validation RulesA maximum of 2 characters may be entered.The following values are permitted: Y NO
properties.name: MAND_Y_N

properties.documentation: Indicates whether counterparty (broker) limits are to be applied for deliveries of this type.TO.BE.RECD.OR.DEL must be set to Y for input to be made.Y indicates that counterparty limit checking will take place for deals input via SEC.TRADE.Validation RulesOptional Input Input is only allowed if TO.BE.RECD.OR.DEL is set to Y. If input must be either Y or NO.
properties.name: COUNTERPARTY_LIMIT

properties.documentation: Indicates whether automatic settlement of counterparty limits take place.Input to this field is only valid if both TO.BE.RECD.OR.DEL and COUNTERPARTY.LIMIT are set to Y.If automatic settlement of counterparty limits take place then during the batch relevant to the value date of the SEC.TRADE deal the corresponding SEC.DEL.CONTROL record will updated as if complete settlement has taken place and the counterparty limit will reflect this.If automatic settlement is set to NO (or left blank) then the user must update the relevant SEC.DEL.CONTROL record to indicate that delivery has taken place at which stage limits will be updated to reflect this.Validation RulesOptional input. Input is only allowed if TO.BE.RECD.OR.DEL and COUNTERPARTY.LIMIT are set to Y. If input is made must be either Y or NO.
properties.name: AUTO_SETTLE_LIMIT
en
properties.value: Indicates the User who Authorises the record

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited

classes.documentation: NOMINEE.CODE Any international bank offering a client a "Safe Custody" facility for stocks and shares held by that customer would have several nominee companies set up to facilitate easy transfer and delivery of those particular securities. As these 'Instruments' are traded and delivered in various ways a bank must be able to handle each and every type of security. Registered stocks and shares are delivered by means of a stock transfer form. The client exists on the issuing company's register. To avoid having to contact each client for each transaction where a registered stock is traded and transfer forms need to be completed by the registered holders; the custodian bank will set itself up as a 'Nominee' company acting on behalf of its various clients. They will have duly appointed authorised signatories and their 'Accounts' as such are audited annually as part of the pre-requisites for setting up that company. They will then act on behalf of their clients in transferring and administration duties on those securities held in that nominee name. As it is an important legal 'vehicle' it forms part of the SECURITY.POSITION key. A shortfall due to an oversale or a wrongly utilised NOMINEE.CODE would cause delay and confusion.
classes.name: NOMINEE_CODE

properties.documentation: Unique reference which identifies the nominee company record. Validation Rules1 to 5 type S (uppercase alpha or numeric) characters. (Mandatory Input)
properties.name: NOMINEE_CODE

properties.documentation: Indicates whether or not the bank has the power of attorney over the nominee company or not. That is, it make decisions concerning securities held within that account or not. If not, then the bank will carry out normal "Safe Custody" type duties without being able to make decisions without the "Go Ahead" from authorised personnel. Validation RulesY = yes or N(O) = no, only (Mandatory Input)
properties.name: BANK_SUPERVISED
en

properties.name: en
properties.value: Date and time when record was audited
